statement and internal control over financial reportingwe have audited the consolidated financial statement including the related note listed in the index appearing under item and the financial statement schedule listed in the index appearing under item ii of exelon corporation and it subsidiary the company collectively referred to the consolidated financial statement we also have audited the company internal control over financial reporting of december based on criterion established in internal control integrated framework issued by the committee of sponsoring organization of the treadway commission coso in our opinion the consolidated financial statement referred to above present fairly in all material respect the financial position of the company of december and and the result of it operation and it cash flow for each of the three year in the period ended december in conformity with accounting principle generally accepted in the united state of america also in our opinion the company maintained in all material respect effective internal control over financial reporting of december based on criterion established in internal control integrated framework issued by the coso basis for opinionsthe company management is responsible for these consolidated financial statement for maintaining effective internal control over financial reporting and for it assessment of the effectiveness of internal control over financial reporting included in management report on internal control over financial reporting appearing under item our responsibility is to express opinion on the company consolidated financial statement and on the company internal control over financial reporting based on our audit we are public accounting firm registered with the public company accounting oversight board united state pcaob and are required to be independent with respect to the company in accordance with the federal security law and the applicable rule and regulation of the security and exchange commission and the pcaob we conducted our audit in accordance with the standard of the pcaob those standard require that we plan and perform the audit to obtain reasonable assurance about whether the consolidated financial statement are free of material misstatement whether due to error or fraud and whether effective internal control over financial reporting wa maintained in all material respect our audit of the consolidated financial statement included performing procedure to ass the risk of material misstatement of the consolidated financial statement whether due to error or fraud and performing procedure that respond to those risk such procedure included examining on test basis evidence regarding the amount and disclosure in the consolidated financial statement our audit also included evaluating the accounting principle used and significant estimate made by management well evaluating the overall presentation of the consolidated financial statement our audit of internal control over financial reporting included obtaining an understanding of internal control over financial reporting assessing the risk that material weakness exists and testing and evaluating the design and operating effectiveness of internal control based on the assessed risk our audit also included performing such other procedure we considered necessary in the circumstance we believe that our audit provide reasonable basis for our opinion definition and limitation of internal control over financial reportinga company internal control over financial reporting is process designed to provide reasonable assurance regarding the reliability of financial reporting and the preparation of financial statement for external purpose in accordance with generally accepted accounting principle company internal control over financial reporting includes those policy and procedure that pertain to the maintenance of record that in reasonable detail accurately and fairly reflect the transaction and disposition of the asset of the company ii provide reasonable assurance that transaction are recorded necessary to permit preparation of financial statement in accordance with generally accepted accounting principle and that receipt and expenditure of the company are being made only in accordance with authorization of management and director of the company and iii provide reasonable assurance regarding prevention or timely detection of unauthorized acquisition use or disposition of the company asset that could have material effect on the financial statement of contentsbecause of it inherent limitation internal control over financial reporting may not prevent or detect misstatement also projection of any evaluation of effectiveness to future period are subject to the risk that control may become inadequate because of change in condition or that the degree of compliance with the policy or procedure may deteriorate critical audit mattersthe critical audit matter communicated below are matter arising from the current period audit of the consolidated financial statement that were communicated or required to be communicated to the audit committee and that relate to account or disclosure that are material to the consolidated financial statement and ii involved our especially challenging subjective or complex judgment the communication of critical audit matter doe not alter in any way our opinion on the consolidated financial statement taken whole and we are not by communicating the critical audit matter below providing separate opinion on the critical audit matter or on the account or disclosure to which they relate annual nuclear decommissioning asset retirement obligation aro assessmentas described in note and to the consolidated financial statement the company ha legal obligation to decommission it nuclear generation station following permanent cessation of operation to estimate it decommissioning obligation related to it nuclear generating station for financial accounting and reporting purpose management us probability weighted discounted cash flow model which on unit by unit basis considers multiple outcome scenario that include significant estimate and assumption and are based on decommissioning cost study cost escalation rate probabilistic cash flow model and discount rate management update it aro annually unless circumstance warrant more frequent update based on it review of updated cost study and it annual evaluation of cost escalation factor and probability assigned to various scenario of december the nuclear decommissioning aro wa billion the principal consideration for our determination that performing procedure relating to the company annual nuclear decommissioning aro assessment is critical audit matter are the significant judgment by management when estimating it decommissioning obligation this in turn led to high degree of auditor judgment subjectivity and effort in performing procedure and evaluating the reasonableness of management discounted cash flow model and significant assumption related to decommissioning cost study in addition the audit effort involved the use of professional with specialized skill and knowledge addressing the matter involved performing procedure and evaluating audit evidence in connection with forming our overall opinion on the consolidated financial statement these procedure included testing the effectiveness of control relating to management development of the input assumption and model used in management aro assessment these procedure also included among others testing management process for estimating the decommissioning obligation by evaluating the appropriateness of the discounted cash flow model testing the completeness and accuracy of data used by management and evaluating the reasonableness of management significant assumption related to decommissioning cost study professional with specialized skill and knowledge were used to assist in evaluating the result of decommissioning cost study impairment assessment of long lived generation assetsas described in note and to the consolidated financial statement the company evaluates the carrying value of long lived asset or asset group for recoverability whenever event or change in circumstance indicate that the carrying value of those asset may not be recoverable indicator of impairment may include deteriorating business climate including but not limited to decline in energy price condition of the asset or plan to dispose of long lived asset significantly before the end of it useful life management determines if long lived asset or asset group are potentially impaired by comparing the undiscounted expected future cash flow to the carrying value when indicator of impairment exist when the undiscounted cash flow analysis indicates long lived asset or asset group may not be recoverable the amount of the impairment loss is determined by measuring the excess of the carrying amount of the long lived asset or asset group over it fair value the fair value analysis is primarily based on the income approach using significant unobservable input including revenue and generation forecast projected capital and maintenance expenditure and discount rate of december the total carrying value of long lived generation asset subject to this assessment wa billion of contentsthe principal consideration for our determination that performing procedure relating to the company impairment assessment of long lived generation asset is critical audit matter are the significant judgment by management in assessing the recoverability and estimating the fair value of these long lived generation asset or asset group this in turn led to high degree of auditor judgment subjectivity and effort in performing procedure and evaluating the reasonableness of management significant assumption related to revenue and generation forecast in addition the audit effort involved the use of professional with specialized skill and knowledge addressing the matter involved performing procedure and evaluating audit evidence in connection with forming our overall opinion on the consolidated financial statement these procedure included testing the effectiveness of control relating to management development of the input assumption and model used to ass the recoverability and estimate the fair value of the company long lived generation asset or asset group these procedure also included among others testing management process for developing the expected future cash flow for the long lived generation asset or asset group by evaluating the appropriateness of the future cash flow model testing the completeness and accuracy of the data used by management and evaluating the reasonableness of management significant assumption related to revenue and generation forecast evaluating the reasonableness of the revenue and generation forecast involved considering whether the forecast were consistent with future commodity price and external market data professional with specialized skill and knowledge were used to assist in evaluating the reasonableness of the revenue forecast accounting for the effect of rate regulationas described in note and to the consolidated financial statement the company applies the authoritative guidance for accounting for certain type of regulation which requires management to record in the consolidated financial statement the effect of cost based rate regulation for entity with regulated operation that meet the following criterion rate are established or approved by third party regulator ii rate are designed to recover the entity cost of providing service or product and iii there is reasonable expectation that rate designed to recover cost can be charged to and collected from customer the company account for it regulated operation in accordance with regulatory and legislative guidance from the regulatory authority having jurisdiction under state public utility law and the ferc under various federal law upon update in material regulatory and legislative proceeding where applicable management will record new regulatory asset or liability and will ass whether it is probable that it currently recorded regulatory asset and liability will be recovered and settled respectively in future rate of december there were billion of regulatory asset and billion of regulatory liability the principal consideration for our determination that performing procedure relating to the company accounting for the effect of rate regulation is critical audit matter are the high degree of audit effort to ass the impact of regulation on accounting for regulatory asset and liability and to evaluate the complex audit evidence related to whether the regulatory asset and liability will be recovered and settled addressing the matter involved performing procedure and evaluating audit evidence in connection with forming our overall opinion on the consolidated financial statement these procedure included testing the effectiveness of control relating to accounting for regulatory matter and evaluation of new and existing regulatory asset and liability these procedure also included among others obtaining the company correspondence with regulator evaluating the reasonableness of management interpretation of regulatory guidance and proceeding and the related accounting implication and recalculating regulatory asset and liability based on provision outlined in rate order and other correspondence with regulator pricewaterhousecoopers llp chicago illinoisfebruary have served the company auditor since of contentsreport of independent registered public accounting firm to the board of director and shareholder of commonwealth edison companyopinion on the financial statement we have audited the consolidated financial statement including the related note listed in the index appearing under item and the financial statement schedule listed in the index appearing under item ii of commonwealth edison company and it subsidiary the company collectively referred to the consolidated financial statement in our opinion the consolidated financial statement present fairly in all material respect the financial position of the company of december and and the result of it operation and it cash flow for each of the three year in the period ended december in conformity with accounting principle generally accepted in the united state of america basis for opinionthese consolidated financial statement are the responsibility of the company management our responsibility is to express an opinion on the company consolidated financial statement based on our audit we are public accounting firm registered with the public company accounting oversight board united state pcaob and are required to be independent with respect to the company in accordance with the federal security law and the applicable rule and regulation of the security and exchange commission and the pcaob we conducted our audit of these consolidated financial statement in accordance with the standard of the pcaob those standard require that we plan and perform the audit to obtain reasonable assurance about whether the consolidated financial statement are free of material misstatement whether due to error or fraud the company is not required to have nor were we engaged to perform an audit of it internal control over financial reporting part of our audit we are required to obtain an understanding of internal control over financial reporting but not for the purpose of expressing an opinion on the effectiveness of the company internal control over financial reporting accordingly we express no such opinion our audit included performing procedure to ass the risk of material misstatement of the consolidated financial statement whether due to error or fraud and performing procedure that respond to those risk such procedure included examining on test basis evidence regarding the amount and disclosure in the consolidated financial statement our audit also included evaluating the accounting principle used and significant estimate made by management well evaluating the overall presentation of the consolidated financial statement we believe that our audit provide reasonable basis for our opinion critical audit mattersthe critical audit matter communicated below is matter arising from the current period audit of the consolidated financial statement that wa communicated or required to be communicated to the audit committee and that relates to account or disclosure that are material to the consolidated financial statement and ii involved our especially challenging subjective or complex judgment the communication of critical audit matter doe not alter in any way our opinion on the consolidated financial statement taken whole and we are not by communicating the critical audit matter below providing separate opinion on the critical audit matter or on the account or disclosure to which it relates accounting for the effect of rate regulationas described in note and to the consolidated financial statement the company applies the authoritative guidance for accounting for certain type of regulation which requires management to record in the consolidated financial statement the effect of cost based rate regulation for entity with regulated operation that meet the following criterion rate are established or approved by third party regulator ii rate are designed to recover the entity cost of providing service or product and iii there is reasonable expectation that rate designed to recover cost can be charged to and collected from customer the company account for it regulated operation in accordance with regulatory and legislative guidance from the regulatory authority having jurisdiction under state public utility law and the ferc under various federal law upon update in material regulatory and legislative proceeding where applicable management will record new regulatory asset or liability and will ass whether it is probable that it currently recorded regulatory asset and liability will be of contentsrecovered and settled respectively in future rate of december there were billion of regulatory asset and billion of regulatory liability the principal consideration for our determination that performing procedure relating to the company accounting for the effect of rate regulation is critical audit matter are the high degree of audit effort to ass the impact of regulation on accounting for regulatory asset and liability and to evaluate the complex audit evidence related to whether the regulatory asset and liability will be recovered and settled addressing the matter involved performing procedure and evaluating audit evidence in connection with forming our overall opinion on the consolidated financial statement these procedure included testing the effectiveness of control relating to accounting for regulatory matter and evaluation of new and existing regulatory asset and liability these procedure also included among others obtaining the company correspondence with regulator evaluating the reasonableness of management interpretation of regulatory guidance and proceeding and the related accounting implication and recalculating regulatory asset and liability based on provision outlined in rate order and other correspondence with regulator pricewaterhousecoopers llpchicago the applicable subsidiary the result of exelon corporate operation are presented other within the consolidated financial statement and include intercompany elimination unless otherwise disclosed of december and exelon owned of generation peco bge and phi and more than of comed phi owns of pepco dpl and ace generation owns of it significant consolidated subsidiary either directly or indirectly except for certain consolidated vies including crp of which generation hold interest the remaining interest in the consolidated vies are included in noncontrolling interest on exelon consolidated balance sheet see note variable interest entity for additional information on vies of february result of the completion of the separation exelon no longer owns any interest in generation see note separation for additional information the registrant consolidate the account of entity in which registrant ha controlling financial interest after the elimination of intercompany transaction where the registrant do not have controlling financial interest in an entity proportionate consolidation equity method accounting or accounting for investment in equity security with or without readily determinable fair value is applied the registrant apply proportionate consolidation when they have an undivided interest in an asset and are proportionately liable for their share of each liability associated with the asset the registrant proportionately consolidate their undivided ownership interest in jointly owned electric plant and transmission facility under proportionate consolidation the registrant separately record their proportionate share of the asset liability revenue and expense related to the undivided interest in the asset the registrant apply equity method accounting when they have significant influence over an investee through an ownership in common stock which generally approximates to voting interest the registrant apply equity method accounting to certain investment and joint venture under equity method accounting the registrant report their interest in the entity an investment and the registrant percentage share of the earnings from the entity single line item in their financial statement the registrant use accounting for investment in equity security with or without readily determinable fair value if they lack significant influence which generally result when they hold le than of the common stock of an entity under accounting for investment in equity security with readily determinable fair value the registrant report their investment value based on quoted price in active market and realized and unrealized gain and loss are included in earnings under accounting for investment in equity security without readily determinable fair value the registrant report their investment at cost adjusted for change from observable transaction for identical or similar investment of the same issuer le impairment and change in measurement are reported in earnings the accompanying consolidated financial statement have been prepared in accordance with gaap for annual financial statement and in accordance with the instruction to form and regulation promulgated by the sec covid all registrant the registrant have taken step to mitigate the potential risk posed by the global outbreak pandemic of the novel coronavirus covid the registrant provide critical service to their customer and have taken measure to keep employee who operate the business safe and minimize unnecessary risk of exposure to the virus including extra precaution for employee who work in the field the registrant have implemented work from home policy where appropriate and imposed travel limitation on employee management make estimate and assumption that affect the reported amount of asset and liability and disclosure of contingent asset and liability of the date of the financial statement and accompanying note and the amount of revenue and expense reported during the period covered by those financial statement and accompanying note of december and and through the date of this report management assessed certain accounting matter that require consideration of forecasted financial information including but not limited to allowance for credit loss and the carrying value of goodwill and other long lived asset in context with the information reasonably available and the unknown future impact of covid the registrant future assessment of the magnitude and duration of covid well other factor could result in material impact to their consolidated financial statement in future reporting period of contentscombined note to consolidated financial statement dollar in million except per share data unless otherwise noted note significant accounting policiesuse of estimate all registrant the preparation of financial statement of each of the registrant in conformity with gaap requires management to make estimate and assumption that affect the amount reported in the financial statement and accompanying note area in which significant estimate have been made include but are not limited to the accounting for nuclear decommissioning cost and other aros pension and opeb inventory reserve allowance for credit loss goodwill and long lived asset impairment assessment derivative instrument unamortized energy contract fixed asset depreciation environmental cost and other loss contingency tax and unbilled energy revenue actual result could differ from those estimate accounting for the effect of regulation all registrant for their regulated electric and gas operation the registrant reflect the effect of cost based rate regulation in their financial statement which is required for entity with regulated operation that meet the following criterion rate are established or approved by third party regulator rate are designed to recover the entity cost of providing service or product and there is reasonable expectation that rate designed to recover cost can be charged to and collected from customer the registrant account for their regulated operation in accordance with regulatory and legislative guidance from the regulatory authority having jurisdiction principally the icc papuc mdpsc dcpsc depsc and njbpu under state public utility law and the ferc under various federal law regulatory asset and liability are amortized and the related expense or revenue is recognized in the consolidated statement of operation consistent with the recovery or refund included in customer rate the registrant regulatory asset and liability of the balance sheet date are probable of being recovered or settled in future rate if separable portion of the registrant business wa no longer able to meet the criterion discussed above the affected entity would be required to eliminate from their consolidated financial statement the effect of regulation for that portion which could have material impact on their financial statement see note regulatory matter for additional information with the exception of income tax related regulatory asset and liability the registrant classify regulatory asset and liability with recovery or settlement period greater than one year both current and non current in their consolidated balance sheet with the current portion representing the amount expected to be recovered from or refunded to customer over the next twelve month period of the balance sheet date income tax related regulatory asset and liability are classified entirely non current in the registrant consolidated balance sheet to align with the classification of the related deferred income tax balance the registrant treat the impact of final rate order received after the balance sheet date but prior to the issuance of the financial statement non recognized subsequent event the receipt of final rate order is separate and distinct event that ha future impact on the party affected by the order revenue all registrant operating revenue the registrant operating revenue generally consist of revenue from contract with customer involving the sale and delivery of energy commodity and related product and service utility revenue from arp and realized and unrealized revenue recognized under mark to market energy commodity derivative contract the registrant recognize revenue from contract with customer to depict the transfer of good or service to customer in an amount that the entity expect to be entitled to in exchange for those good or service generation primary source of revenue include competitive sale of power natural gas and other energy related product and service the utility registrant primary source of revenue include regulated electric and natural gas tariff sale distribution and transmission service at the end of each month the registrant accrue an estimate for the unbilled amount of energy delivered or service provided to customer comed record arp revenue for it best estimate of the electric distribution energy efficiency and transmission revenue impact resulting from future change in rate that comed belief are probable of approval by the icc and ferc in accordance with it formula rate mechanism bge pepco dpl and ace record arp revenue for their best estimate of the electric and natural gas distribution revenue impact resulting from future change in rate that they believe are probable of approval by the mdpsc dcpsc and or njbpu in accordance with their revenue decoupling mechanism peco bge pepco dpl and ace record arp revenue for their best estimate of the transmission revenue impact resulting from future change in rate that they believe are probable of approval by ferc in accordance with their formula rate mechanism see note regulatory matter for additional information of contentscombined note to consolidated financial statement dollar in million except per share data unless otherwise noted note significant accounting policiesoption contract swap and commodity derivative certain option contract and swap arrangement that meet the definition of derivative instrument are recorded at fair value with subsequent change in fair value recognized revenue or expense the classification of revenue or expense is based on the intent of the transaction to the extent utility registrant receives full cost recovery for energy procurement and related cost from retail customer it record the fair value of it energy swap contract with unaffiliated supplier well an offsetting regulatory asset or liability in it consolidated balance sheet see note regulatory matter and note derivative financial instrument for additional information tax directly imposed on revenue producing transaction the registrant collect certain tax from customer such sale and gross receipt tax along with other tax surcharge and fee that are levied by state or local government on the sale or distribution of electricity and gas some of these tax are imposed on the customer but paid by the registrant while others are imposed on the registrant where these tax are imposed on the customer such sale tax they are reported on net basis with no impact to the consolidated statement of operation and comprehensive income however where these tax are imposed on the registrant such gross receipt tax or other surcharge or fee they are reported on gross basis accordingly revenue are recognized for the tax collected from customer along with an offsetting expense see note supplemental financial information for tax that are presented on gross basis lease all registrant the registrant recognize rou asset and lease liability for operating and finance lease with term of greater than one year operating lease rou asset are included in other deferred debit and other asset and operating lease liability are included in other current liability and other deferred credit and other liability on the consolidated balance sheet finance lease rou asset are included in plant property and equipment net and finance lease liability are included in long term debt due within one year and long term debt on the consolidated balance sheet the rou asset is measured the sum of the present value of all remaining fixed and in substance fixed payment using the rate implicit in the lease whenever that is readily determinable or each registrant incremental borrowing rate any lease payment made at or before the commencement date le any lease incentive received and any initial direct cost incurred the lease liability is measured the same the rou asset but excludes any payment made before the commencement date and initial direct cost incurred lease term include option to extend or terminate the lease if it is reasonably certain they will be exercised the registrant include non lease component for most asset class which are service related cost that are not integral to the use of the asset in the measurement of the rou asset and lease liability expense for operating lease and lease with term of one year or le is recognized on straight line basis over the term of the lease unless another systematic and rational basis is more representative of the derivation of benefit from use of the leased property variable lease payment are recognized in the period in which the related obligation is incurred and consist primarily of payment for purchase of electricity under contracted generation that are based on the electricity produced by those generating asset operating lease expense and variable lease payment are recorded to purchased power and fuel expense for contracted generation or operating and maintenance expense for all other lease agreement on the registrant statement of operation and comprehensive income expense for finance lease is primarily recorded to operating and maintenance on the registrant statement of operation and comprehensive income income from operating lease including sublease is recognized on straight line basis over the term of the lease unless another systematic and rational basis is more representative of the pattern in which income is earned over the term of the lease variable lease payment are recognized in the period in which the related obligation is performed and consist primarily of payment received from sale of electricity under contracted generation that are based on the electricity produced by those generating asset operating lease income and variable lease payment are recorded to operating revenue on the registrant statement of operation and comprehensive income the registrant operating and finance lease consist primarily of contracted generation real estate including office building and vehicle and equipment the registrant generally account for contracted generation in which the generating asset is not renewable lease if the customer ha dispatch right and obtains substantially all the economic benefit the registrant generally do not account for contracted generation in which the generating asset is renewable lease if the customer doe not design the generating asset the registrant account for land right arrangement that provide for exclusive use lease while shared use land of contentscombined note to consolidated financial statement dollar in million except per share data unless otherwise noted note significant accounting policiesarrangements are generally not lease the registrant do not account for secondary use pole attachment lease see note lease for additional information income tax all registrant deferred federal and state income tax are recorded on significant temporary difference between the book and tax basis of asset and liability and for tax benefit carried forward investment tax credit have been deferred in the registrant consolidated balance sheet and are recognized in book income over the life of the related property the registrant account for uncertain income tax position using benefit recognition model with two step approach more likely than not recognition criterion and measurement approach that measure the position the largest amount of tax benefit that is greater than likely of being realized upon ultimate settlement if it is not more likely than not that the benefit of the tax position will be sustained on it technical merit no benefit is recorded uncertain tax position that relate only to timing of when an item is included on tax return are considered to have met the recognition threshold the registrant recognize accrued interest related to unrecognized tax benefit in interest expense net or other net interest income and recognize penalty related to unrecognized tax benefit in other net in their consolidated statement of operation and comprehensive income cash and cash equivalent all registrant the registrant consider investment purchased with an original maturity of three month or le to be cash equivalent restricted cash and cash equivalent all registrant restricted cash and cash equivalent represent fund that are restricted to satisfy designated current liability of december and the registrant restricted cash and cash equivalent primarily represented the following item registrantdescriptionexelonpayment of medical dental vision and long term disability benefit and generation project specific nonrecourse financing structure for debt service and financing of operation of the underlying entity in addition to the item listed below for the utility registrant comedcollateral held from supplier associated with energy and rec procurement contract any over recovered rps cost and alternative compliance forecast of contentscombined note to consolidated financial statement dollar in million except per share data unless otherwise noted note significant accounting policiesthe allowance for credit loss for generation retail customer is based on account receivable aging historical experience coupled with specific identification through credit monitoring process which considers current condition and forward looking information such industry trend macroeconomic factor change in the regulatory environment external credit rating publicly available news payment status payment history and the exercise of collateral call the allowance for credit loss for generation wholesale customer is developed using credit monitoring process like that used for retail customer when wholesale customer risk characteristic are no longer aligned with the pooled population generation us specific identification to develop an allowance for credit loss adjustment to the allowance for credit loss are recorded in operating and maintenance expense in exelon consolidated statement of operation and comprehensive income the allowance for credit loss for the utility registrant customer is developed by applying loss rate for each utility registrant based on historical loss experience current condition and forward looking risk factor to the outstanding receivable balance by customer risk segment utility registrant customer account are written off consistent with approved regulatory requirement adjustment to the allowance for credit loss are primarily recorded to operating and maintenance expense on the utility registrant consolidated statement of operation and comprehensive income or regulatory asset and liability on the utility registrant consolidated balance sheet see note regulatory matter for additional information regarding the regulatory recovery of credit loss on customer account receivable the registrant have certain non customer receivables in other deferred debit and other asset which primarily are with governmental agency and other high quality counterparties with no history of default such the allowance for credit loss related to these receivables is not material the registrant monitor these balance and will record an allowance if there are indicator of decline in credit quality variable interest entity exelon phi and ace exelon account for it investment in and arrangement with vies based on the following specific requirement qualitative assessment of factor determinant in whether it ha controlling financial interest ongoing reconsideration of this assessment and where it consolidates vie primary beneficiary disclosure of the asset of the consolidated vie if they can be used to only settle specific obligation of the consolidated vie and the liability of consolidated vie for which creditor do not have recourse to the general credit of the primary beneficiary see note variable interest entity for additional information inventory all registrant inventory is recorded at the lower of weighted average cost or net realizable value provision are recorded for excess and obsolete inventory fossil fuel material and supply and emission allowance are generally included in inventory when purchased fossil fuel and emission allowance are expensed to purchased power and fuel expense when used or sold material and supply generally includes transmission distribution and generating plant material and are expensed to operating and maintenance or capitalized to property plant and equipment appropriate when installed or used debt for additional information property plant and equipment all registrant property plant and equipment is recorded at original cost original cost includes construction related direct labor and material cost the utility registrant also include indirect construction cost including labor and related cost of department associated with supporting construction activity when appropriate original cost also includes capitalized interest for generation exelon corporate and phi and afudc for regulated property at the utility registrant the cost of repair and maintenance and minor replacement of property is charged to operating and maintenance expense incurred third party reimburse the utility registrant for all or portion of expenditure for certain capital project such contribution in aid of construction cost ciac are recorded reduction to property plant and equipment net for generation upon retirement the cost of property is generally charged to accumulated depreciation in accordance with the composite and group method of depreciation upon replacement of an asset the cost to remove the asset net of salvage are capitalized to gross plant when incurred part of the cost of the newly installed asset and recorded to depreciation expense over the life of the new asset removal cost net of salvage incurred for property that will not be replaced is charged to operating and maintenance expense incurred for the utility registrant upon retirement the cost of property net of salvage is charged to accumulated depreciation consistent with the composite and group method of depreciation depreciation expense at comed bge pepco dpl and ace includes the estimated cost of dismantling and removing plant from service upon retirement actual incurred removal cost are applied against related regulatory liability or recorded to regulatory asset if in excess of previously collected removal cost peco removal cost are capitalized to accumulated depreciation when incurred and recorded to depreciation expense over the life of the new asset constructed consistent with peco regulatory recovery method capitalized software certain cost such design coding and testing incurred during the application development stage of software project that are internally developed or purchased for operational use are capitalized within property plant and equipment similar cost incurred for cloud based solution treated service arrangement are capitalized within other current asset and deferred debit and other asset such capitalized amount are amortized ratably over the expected life of the project when they become operational generally not to exceed five year certain other capitalized software cost are being amortized over longer life based on the expected life or pursuant to prescribed regulatory requirement capitalized interest and afudc during construction exelon capitalizes the cost of debt fund used to finance non regulated construction project capitalization of debt fund is recorded charge to construction work in progress and non cash credit to interest expense afudc is the cost during the period of construction of debt and equity fund used to finance construction project for regulated operation afudc is recorded to construction work in progress and non cash credit to an allowance that is included in interest expense for debt related fund and other income and deduction for equity related fund the rate used for capitalizing afudc are computed under method prescribed by regulatory authority see note property plant and equipment note jointly owned electric utility plant and note supplemental financial information for additional information of contentscombined note to consolidated financial statement dollar in million except per share data unless otherwise noted note significant accounting policiesnuclear fuel exelon the cost of nuclear fuel is capitalized in property plant and equipment and charged to purchased power and fuel expense using the unit of production method any potential future snf disposal fee will also be expensed through purchased power and fuel expense additionally certain on site snf storage cost are being reimbursed by the doe since doe or government owned long term storage facility ha not been completed see note commitment and contingency for additional information regarding the cost of snf storage and disposal nuclear outage cost exelon cost associated with nuclear outage including planned major maintenance activity are expensed to operating and maintenance expense or capitalized to property plant and equipment based on the nature of the activity in the period incurred depreciation and amortization all registrant except for the amortization of nuclear fuel depreciation is generally recorded over the estimated service life of property plant and equipment on straight line basis using the group composite or unitary method of depreciation the group approach is typically for group of similar asset that have approximately the same useful life and the composite approach is used for dissimilar asset that have different life under both method reporting entity depreciates the asset over the average life of the asset in the group comed bge pepco dpl and ace depreciation expense includes the estimated cost of dismantling and removing plant from service upon retirement which is consistent with each utility regulatory recovery method peco removal cost are capitalized to accumulated depreciation when incurred and recorded to depreciation expense over the life of the new asset constructed consistent with peco regulatory recovery method the estimated service life for the registrant are based on combination of depreciation study historical retirement site license and management estimate of operating cost and expected future energy market condition see note early plant retirement for additional information on the impact of early plant retirement see note property plant and equipment for additional information regarding depreciation amortization of regulatory asset and liability are recorded over the recovery or refund period specified in the related legislation or regulatory order or agreement when the recovery or refund period is le than one year amortization is recorded to the line item in which the deferred cost or income would have originally been recorded in the utility registrant consolidated statement of operation and comprehensive income amortization of comed electric distribution and energy efficiency formula rate regulatory asset and the utility registrant transmission formula rate regulatory asset is recorded to operating revenue amortization of income tax related regulatory asset and liability is generally recorded to income tax expense except for the regulatory asset and liability discussed above amortization is generally recorded to depreciation and amortization in the registrant consolidated statement of operation and comprehensive income when the recovery period is more than one year see note regulatory matter and note supplemental financial information for additional information regarding the amortization of the utility registrant regulatory asset and generation nuclear fuel and arc respectively asset retirement obligation all registrant the registrant estimate and recognize liability for their legal obligation to perform asset retirement activity even though the timing and or method of settlement may be conditional on future event generation generally update it nuclear decommissioning aro annually unless circumstance warrant more frequent update based on it annual evaluation of cost escalation factor and probability assigned to the multiple outcome scenario within it probability weighted discounted cash flow model generation multiple outcome scenario are generally based on decommissioning cost study which are updated on rotational basis for each of generation nuclear unit at least every five year unless circumstance warrant more frequent update the utility registrant update their aros either annually or on rotational basis at least once every three year based on risk profile unless circumstance warrant more frequent update the update factor in new cost estimate credit adjusted risk free rate carfr and escalation rate and the timing of cash flow aros are accreted throughout each year to reflect the time value of money for these present value obligation through of contentscombined note to consolidated financial statement dollar in million except per share data obligation for additional information guarantee all registrant if necessary the registrant recognize liability at the time of issuance of guarantee for the fair value of the obligation they have undertaken by issuing the guarantee the liability is reduced or eliminated the registrant are released from risk under the guarantee depending on the nature of the guarantee the release from risk of the registrant may be recognized only upon the expiration or settlement of the guarantee or by systematic and rational amortization method over the term of the guarantee see note commitment and contingency for additional information asset impairment long lived asset all registrant the registrant regularly monitor and evaluate the carrying value of long lived asset or asset group for recoverability whenever event or change in circumstance indicate that the carrying value of those asset may not be recoverable indicator of impairment may include deteriorating business climate including but not limited to decline in energy price condition of the asset specific regulatory disallowance or plan to dispose of long lived asset significantly before the end of it useful life the registrant determine if long lived asset or asset group are potentially impaired by comparing the undiscounted expected future cash flow to the carrying value when indicator of impairment exist when the undiscounted cash flow analysis indicates long lived asset or asset group may not be recoverable the amount of the impairment loss is determined by measuring the excess of the carrying amount of the long lived asset or asset group over it fair value see note asset impairment for additional information goodwill exelon comed and phi goodwill represents the excess of the purchase price paid over the estimated fair value of the net asset acquired and liability assumed in the acquisition of business goodwill is not amortized but is assessed for impairment at least annually or on an interim basis if an event occurs or circumstance change that would more likely than not reduce the fair value of reporting unit below it carrying value see note intangible asset for additional information equity method investment exelon exelon regularly monitor and evaluates equity method investment to determine whether they are impaired an impairment is recorded when the investment ha experienced decline in value that is other than temporary in nature additionally if the entity in which exelon hold an investment recognizes an impairment loss exelon would record their proportionate share of that impairment loss and evaluate the investment for an other than temporary decline in value debt security investment exelon decline in the fair value of debt security investment below the cost basis are reviewed to determine if such decline are other than temporary if the decline is determined to be other than temporary the amount of the impairment loss is included in earnings equity security investment exelon equity investment with readily determinable fair value are measured and recorded at fair value with any change in fair value recorded in earnings investment in equity security without readily determinable fair value are qualitatively assessed for impairment each reporting period if it is determined that the equity security is impaired an impairment loss will be recognized in earnings to the amount by which the security carrying amount exceeds it fair value derivative financial instrument all registrant all derivative are recognized on the balance sheet at their fair value unless they qualify for certain exception including npns for derivative intended to serve economic hedge change in fair value are recognized in earnings each period amount classified in earnings are included in operating revenue purchased power and fuel interest expense or other net in the consolidated statement of operation and comprehensive income based on the activity the transaction is economically hedging while most of the derivative serve economic hedge there are also derivative entered into for proprietary trading purpose subject to exelon rmp and change in the fair value of those derivative are recorded in revenue or expense in the consolidated statement of operation and comprehensive income at the utility registrant change in fair value may be recorded regulatory asset or liability if there is an ability to recover or return the associated cost cash inflow and of contentscombined note to consolidated financial statement dollar in million except per share data unless otherwise noted note significant accounting policiesoutflows related to derivative instrument are included component of operating investing or financing cash flow in the consolidated statement of cash flow depending on the nature of each transaction see note regulatory matter and note derivative financial instrument for additional information part of generation energy marketing business generation enters contract to buy and sell energy to meet the requirement of it customer these contract include short term and long term commitment to purchase and sell energy and energy related product in the energy market with the intent and ability to deliver or take delivery of the underlying physical commodity npns are contract where physical delivery is probable quantity are expected to be used or sold in the normal course of business over reasonable period and will not be financially settled revenue and expense on derivative contract that qualify and are designated npns are recognized when the underlying physical transaction is completed while these contract are considered derivative financial instrument they are not required to be recorded at fair value see note derivative financial instrument for additional information retirement benefit all registrant exelon sponsor defined benefit pension plan and opeb plan for substantially all current employee the plan obligation and cost of providing benefit under these plan are measured of december the measurement involves various factor assumption and accounting election the impact of assumption change or experience different from that assumed on pension and opeb obligation is recognized over time rather than immediately recognized in the consolidated statement of operation and comprehensive income gain or loss in excess of the greater of ten percent of the projected benefit obligation or the mrv of plan asset are amortized over the expected average remaining service period of plan participant see note retirement benefit for energy law exelon and comed on september the illinois public act wa signed into law by the governor of illinois clean energy law the clean energy law includes among other feature procurement of cmcs from qualifying nuclear powered generating facility requirement to file general rate case or new four year multi year plan no later than january to establish rate effective after comed existing performance based distribution formula rate sunset an extension of and certain adjustment to comed energy efficiency mwh saving goal revision to the illinois rps requirement including expanded charge for the procurement of recs from wind and solar generation requirement to accelerate amortization of comed unprotected excess deferred income tax that comed wa previously directed by the icc to amortize using the average rate assumption method which equates to approximately year and requirement that the icc initiate and conduct various regulatory proceeding on subject including ethic spending grid investment and performance metric regulatory or legal challenge regarding the validity or implementation of the clean energy law are possible and exelon and comed can not reasonably predict the outcome of any such challenge carbon mitigation creditthe clean energy law establishes decarbonization requirement for illinois well program to support the retention and development of emission free source of electricity among other thing the clean energy law of contentscombined note to consolidated financial statement dollar in million except per share data unless otherwise noted note regulatory mattersauthorized the ipa to procure up to million cmcs from qualifying nuclear plant for five year period beginning on june through may cmcs are credit for the carbon free attribute of eligible nuclear power plant in pjm the byron dresden and braidwood nuclear plant located in illinois participated in the cmc procurement process and were awarded contract that commit each plant to operate through may pursuant to these contract comed will procure cmcs based upon the number of mwhs produced annually by each plant subject to minimum performance requirement the price to be paid for each cmc wa established through competitive bidding process that included consumer protection measure that capped the maximum acceptable bid amount and formula that reduces cmc price by an energy price index the base residual auction capacity price in the comed zone of pjm and the monetized value of any federal tax credit or other subsidy if applicable the consumer protection measure contained in the new law will result in net payment to comed ratepayer if the energy index the capacity price and applicable federal tax credit or subsidy exceed the cmc contract price comed is required to purchase cmcs pursuant to these contract and all it cost of doing so will be recovered through new rider that rider will provide for an annual reconciliation and true up to actual cost incurred by comed to purchase cmcs with any difference to be credited to or collected from comed retail customer in subsequent period see note early plant retirement for the impact of the provision above on the illinois nuclear plant and exelon consolidated financial statement the provision do not impact comed consolidated financial statement until comed electric distribution ratesthe clean energy law contains requirement associated with comed transition away from the performance based electric distribution formula rate the law authorizing that rate setting process sunset at the end of the clean energy law and tariff adopted under it governs both the remaining reconciliation of rate set under that formula process and requires comed to file in it choice of either general rate case or four year multi year plan to set rate that take effect in on february the icc approved tariff that establishes the process under which comed will reconcile it and rate year revenue requirement with actual cost those reconciliation amount will be determined using the same process were used for prior reconciliation under the performance based electric distribution formula rate using that process for the year and comed will ultimately collect revenue from customer reflecting each year actual recoverable cost year end rate base and weighted average debt and equity return on distribution rate base with the roe component based on the annual average of the monthly yield of the year united state treasury bond plus basis point if comed elect to file multi year plan that plan would set rate for based on forecasted revenue requirement and an icc determined rate of return on rate base including the cost of common equity each year of the multi year plan is subject to after the fact icc review and reconciliation of the plan revenue requirement for that year with the actual cost that the icc determines are prudently and reasonably incurred for that year that reconciliation is subject to adjustment for certain expense and unless the plan is modified to cap on increase in certain cost over the cost in the previously approved multi year rate plan revenue requirement comed would make it initial reconciliation filing in and the rate adjustment necessary to reconcile revenue to comed actual cost incurred would take effect in january after the icc review the icc must also approve certain annual performance metric which can impose symmetrical performance adjustment in the total range of to basis point to comed rate of return on common equity based on the extent to which comed achieved the annual performance goal comed will recover from retail customer subject to certain exception the cost it incurs pursuant to the clean energy law either through it electric distribution rate or other recovery mechanism the clean energy law among other thing also requires comed rate to include decoupling mechanism to eliminate any impact of weather or load from comed electric distribution rate revenue the clean energy law also requires the icc to initiate docket to accelerate and fully credit to customer unprotected property related tcja excess deferred income tax no later than december energy of contentscombined note to consolidated financial statement dollar in million except per share data unless otherwise noted note regulatory mattersthe clean energy law extends comed current cumulative annual energy efficiency mwh saving goal through add expanded electrification measure to those goal increase low income commitment and add new performance adjustment to the energy efficiency formula rate comed expects it annual spend to increase in through to achieve these energy efficiency mwh saving goal which will be deferred separate regulatory asset that will be recovered through the energy efficiency formula rate over the weighted average useful life approved by the icc of the related energy efficiency measure energy efficiency formula rate exelon and comed feja allows comed to defer energy efficiency cost except for any voltage optimization cost which are recovered through the electric distribution formula rate separate regulatory asset that is recovered through the energy efficiency formula rate over the weighted average useful life approved by the icc of the related energy efficiency measure comed earns return on the energy efficiency regulatory asset at rate equal to it weighted average cost of capital which is based on year end capital structure and calculated using the same methodology applicable to comed electric distribution formula rate beginning january through december the roe that comed earns on it energy efficiency regulatory asset is subject to maximum downward or upward adjustment of basis point if comed cumulative persisting annual mwh saving fall short of or exceeds specified percentage benchmark of it annual incremental saving goal comed is required to file an update to it energy efficiency formula rate on or before june each year with resulting rate effective in january of the following year the annual update is based on projected current year energy efficiency cost pjm capacity revenue and the projected year end regulatory asset balance le any related deferred income tax initial year revenue requirement the update also reconciles any difference between the revenue requirement in effect for the prior year and actual cost incurred from the year annual reconciliation the approved energy efficiency formula rate also provides for revenue decoupling provision similar to those in comed electric distribution formula rate during the icc approved the following total increase in comed requested energy efficiency revenue requirement filing daterequested revenue requirement increaseapproved operating revenue from electric distribution at pepco maryland see also district of columbia revenue decoupling below for pepco district of columbia and dpl are not impacted by abnormal weather or usage per customer for bge pepco and dpl the decoupling mechanism eliminates the impact of abnormal weather or customer usage by recognizing revenue based on an authorized distribution amount per customer by customer class operating revenue from electric and natural gas distribution at bge and operating revenue from electric distribution at pepco maryland and dpl are however impacted by change in the number of customer maryland order directing the distribution of energy assistance fund exelon bge phi pepco and dpl on june the mdpsc issued an order authorizing the disbursal of fund to offsetting reduction to income tax expense in the second quarter of regulatory asset and liabilitiesregulatory asset represent incurred cost that have been deferred because of their probable future recovery from customer through regulated rate regulatory liability represent the excess recovery of cost or accrued credit that have been deferred because it is probable such amount will be returned third district of texas challenging the validity of the puct action generation intervened in that appeal and filed it initial brief on june and reply brief on november on april generation filed travis county texas stay it proceeding pending action by the court of appeal in the third party proceeding on may generation amended it petition for declaratory action and request for judicial review pending in the district court of travis county texas exelon can not reasonably predict the outcome of these proceeding or the potential financial statement impact due to the event number of ercot market participant experienced bankruptcy or defaulted on payment to ercot resulting in approximately billion payment shortfall in collection which is allocated to the remaining ercot market participant of december exelon ha recorded generation estimated portion of this obligation net of legislative solution of approximately million on discounted basis which is to be paid over term of year ercot rule historically have limited recovery of default from market participant to million per month market wide in february the puct gave ercot discretion to disregard those rule but ercot ha declined to exercise that discretion to the imposition of uplift charge on march third party filed notice of appeal in the court of appeal for the third district of texas challenging the validity of the puct order to ercot in february generation intervened in that appeal and filed it initial brief on july the case ha been stayed until march to afford time for the puct to respond to ercot november request that the puct withdraw it february order on may generation filed declaratory action and request for judicial review of the puct order in the district court of travis county texas generation subsequently requested that the district court of travis county texas stay it proceeding pending action by the court of appeal in the third party proceeding exelon can not reasonably predict the outcome of these proceeding or the potential financial statement impact additionally several legislative proposal were introduced in the texas legislature during february and march concerning the amount timing and allocation of recovery of the billion shortfall well recovery of other cost associated with the puct directive to set price at per mwh two of these proposal were enacted into law in june and establish financing mechanism that ercot and certain market participant can utilize to fund amount owed to ercot generation participated in proceeding before the puct addressing the proposed allocation of the billion in securitized fund for reliability and ancillary service charge over per mwh in september generation entered into settlement agreement and stipulation to resolve the allocation issue the puct approved the settlement agreement and stipulation on october in addition other legislative proposal were introduced in the texas legislature during february and march addressing cold weather preparation for power plant and natural gas production and transportation infrastructure and the market structure for reliability service the texas legislature addressed these proposal by enacting bill with broad set of market reform that among other thing directed the puct to establish weatherization standard for electric generator within six month of enactment and gave the puct authority to impose administrative penalty if the new proposed standard once adopted are not met on october the puct adopted rule change requiring generator by december to complete number of specified winter readiness preparation and to submit to ercot report describing and certifying the completion of those preparation the puct described these requirement the first phase of it action with respect to winter preparedness which generation completed timely and will be followed by second phase consisting of year round set of weather preparedness standard to be informed by weather study conducted by ercot and submitted to the puct on december the legislation also directs the puct to evaluate whether additional ancillary service are needed for reliability in the ercot power region to provide adequate incentive for dispatchable generation throughout exelon and others submitted various proposal to the puct with respect to range of potential market reform of contentscombined note to
