other limitation on natural gas transportation or use to manage the operational integrity of the applicable ldc or pipeline system when in effect gas transportation or use above these limitation is subject to significant penalty according to the applicable ldcs and natural gas pipeline tariff gas transportation and supply in many state became restricted due to well freezing and pipeline compression disruption while demand wa increasing due to the extreme cold temperature resulting in extremely high natural gas price due to the extraordinary circumstance many ldcs and natural gas pipeline have either voluntarily waived or have sought applicable regulatory approval to waive the tariff penalty associated with the extreme weather event during march three natural gas pipeline filed individual petition with ferc requesting approval to waive ofo penalty generation also filed motion in march to intervene and filed comment in support of these ferc waiver request on march ferc issued an order on one of the petition approving pipeline request for limited waiver of penalty for february on april generation and several other entity filed request at ferc for rehearing of this order which wa denied on may generation and the other entity filed an appeal of the rehearing of the order with the court of appeal for the circuit on july additionally generation and the other entity filed complaint requesting that ferc expand the order to include additional day of the weather event in february from february through february on october ferc denied the complaint finding that pipeline ha the discretion whether to waive penalty under it tariff and on december the related circuit petition for review wa withdrawn during april ferc issued order on the remaining petition approving the request to waive the penalty during may an ldc filed motion with the kansa corporation commission kcc requesting the kcc to grant waiver from the tariff and allow the ldc to reduce the amount assessed by permitting the removal of multiplier from the penalty calculation on january unanimous settlement that wa filed with the kcc that amended previously filed october and november nonunanimous settlement that if approved would resolve this matter exelon can not predict the outcome of the kcc proceeding illinois regulatory mattersclean energy law see clean energy law above for additional information related to generation see note early plant retirement for additional information on generation illinois nuclear plant new jersey regulatory mattersnew jersey clean energy legislation on may new jersey enacted legislation that established zec program that provides compensation for nuclear plant that demonstrate to the njbpu that they meet certain requirement including that they make significant contribution to air quality in the state and that their revenue are insufficient to cover their cost and risk under the legislation the njbpu will issue zecs to qualifying nuclear power plant and the electric distribution utility in new jersey including ace will be required to purchase those zecs on april the njbpu approved the award of zecs to salem and salem upon approval generation began recognizing revenue for the sale of new jersey zecs in the month they are generated on march three judge panel of the superior court of new jersey appellate division unanimously affirmed the njbpu april order awarding zecs for the first eligibility period on april new jersey rate counsel filed notice asking the new jersey supreme court to hear the appeal of the superior court order on july the new jersey supreme court declined to hear the appeal on october pseg and generation filed application seeking zecs for the second eligibility period june through may on april the njbpu approved the award of zecs to salem and salem for the second eligibility period on may the new jersey rate counsel appealed the april decision to the superior court of new jersey appellate division briefing on the appeal is expected to conclude in the first half of exelon can not reasonably predict the outcome of this proceeding of contentscombined note to consolidated financial statement dollar in million except per share data unless otherwise noted note regulatory mattersfederal regulatory matterspjm and nyiso mopr proceeding pjm and nyiso capacity market include mopr if resource is subjected to mopr it offer is adjusted to effectively remove the revenue it receives through state government provided financial support program resulting in higher offer that may not clear the capacity market prior to december the mopr in pjm applied only to certain new gas fired resource currently the mopr in nyiso applies only to certain resource in downstate new york for generation nuclear facility in pjm and nyiso that are currently receiving state supported compensation for carbon free attribute an expanded mopr would require exclusion of such compensation when bidding into future capacity auction resulting in an increased risk of these facility not receiving capacity revenue in future auction on december ferc required pjm to broadly apply the mopr to all new and existing resource including nuclear renewables demand response energy efficiency storage and all resource owned by vertically integrated utility this greatly expanded the breadth and scope of pjm mopr which became effective of pjm capacity auction for the planning year while ferc included some limited exemption no exemption were available to state supported nuclear resource ferc provided no new mechanism for accommodating state supported resource other than the existing frr mechanism under which an entire utility zone would be removed from pjm capacity auction along with sufficient resource to support the load in such zone in response to ferc order pjm submitted compliance filing on march wherein pjm proposed tariff language interpreting and implementing ferc directive and proposed schedule for resuming capacity auction that is contingent on the timing of ferc action on the compliance filing on april ferc issued an order largely denying most request for rehearing of ferc december order but granting few clarification that required an additional pjm compliance filing which pjm submitted on june number of party including exelon have filed petition for review of ferc order in this proceeding which remain pending before the court of appeal for the seventh circuit result the mopr applied in the capacity auction for the planning year to generation owned or jointly owned nuclear plant in those state receiving benefit under the illinois and the new jersey zec program the mopr prevented quad city from clearing in that capacity auction at the direction of the pjm board of manager pjm and it stakeholder developed further mopr reform to ensure that the capacity market rule respect and accommodate state resource preference such the zec program pjm filed related tariff revision at ferc on july and on september pjm proposed mopr reform became effective by operation of law under the new tariff provision the mopr will no longer apply to any of generation owned or jointly owned nuclear plant request for rehearing of ferc notice establishing the effective date for pjm proposed market reform were filed in october and denied by operation of law on november several party have filed petition for review of ferc order in this proceeding which remain pending before the court of appeal for the third circuit exelon is strenuously opposing these appeal exelon can not predict the outcome of this proceeding on february ferc issued an order rejecting request to expand nyiso version of the mopr referred to buyer side mitigation rule beyond it current limited applicability to certain resource in downstate however on october two natural gas fired generator in new york filed complaint at ferc seeking to expand the mopr in nyiso to apply to all resource new and existing across the entire nyiso market exelon is strenuously opposing expansion of ferc mopr policy in the nyiso market while it is early in the proceeding to predict it outcome and there are significant difference between the nyiso and pjm market that would justify different result if ferc applies the mopr in nyiso broadly requested in the complaint generation facility in nyiso that are receiving zec compensation may be at increased risk of not clearing the capacity auction of contentscombined note to consolidated financial statement dollar in million except per share data unless otherwise noted note regulatory mattersoperating license renewalsconowingo hydroelectric project on august generation submitted an application to ferc for new license for the conowingo hydroelectric project conowingo in connection with generation effort to obtain water quality certification pursuant to section of the clean water act certification from mde for conowingo generation had been working with mde and other stakeholder to resolve water quality licensing issue including water quality fish habitat and sediment on april generation and the fish and wildlife service of the department of the interior executed settlement agreement doi settlement resolving all fish passage issue between the party on april mde issued it certification for conowingo issued the certification contained numerous condition including those relating to reduction of nutrient from upstream source removal of all visible trash and debris from upstream source and implementation of measure relating to fish passage on october generation and mde filed with ferc joint offer of settlement offer of settlement that would resolve all outstanding issue relating to the certification pursuant to the offer of settlement the party submitted proposed license article to ferc to be incorporated by ferc into the new license in accordance with ferc discretionary authority under the federal power act among the proposed license article were modification to river flow to improve aquatic habitat eel passage improvement and initiative to support rare threatened and endangered wildlife on march ferc issued new year license for conowingo effective march ferc adopted the proposed license article into the new license only making modification it deemed necessary to allow ferc to enforce the proposed license article consistent with the offer of settlement ferc found that mde waived it certification and pursuant to separate agreement with mde mde settlement generation agreed to implement additional environmental protection mitigation and enhancement measure over the year term of the new license these measure address mussel restoration and other ecological and water quality matter among other commitment on april few environmental group filed with ferc petition for rehearing requesting that ferc reconsider the issuance of the new conowingo license which wa denied by operation of law on may on june the petitioner appealed ferc ruling to the court of appeal for the circuit on july ferc issued an order addressing the argument raised on rehearing affirming the determination of it march order the financial impact of the doi and mde settlement and other anticipated license commitment are recognized over the new license term including capital and operating cost the actual timing and amount of the majority of these cost are not currently fixed and will vary from year to year throughout the life of the new license peach bottom unit and on march the nrc approved second year license renewal for peach bottom depreciation provision for peach bottom revenue from contract with customer all registrant the registrant recognize revenue from contract with customer to depict the transfer of good or service to customer at an amount that the entity expect to be entitled to in exchange for those good or service generation primary source of revenue include competitive sale of power natural gas and other energy related product and service the utility registrant primary source of revenue include regulated electric and gas tariff sale distribution and transmission service the performance obligation revenue recognition and payment term associated with these source of revenue are further discussed in the table below there are no significant financing component for these source of revenue and no variable consideration for regulated electric and gas tariff sale and regulated transmission service unless noted below unless otherwise noted for each of the significant revenue category and related performance obligation described below the registrant have the right to consideration from the customer in an amount that corresponds directly with the value transferred to the customer for the performance completed to date therefore the registrant generally recognize revenue in the amount for which they have the right to invoice the customer result there are generally no significant judgment used in determining or allocating the transaction price of contentscombined note to consolidated financial statement dollar in million except per share data unless otherwise noted note revenue from contract with customersrevenue sourcedescriptionperformance obligationtiming of revenue recognitionpayment term competitive power sale exelon sale of power and other energy related commodity to wholesale and retail customer across multiple geographic region through generation customer facing business various including the delivery of power generally delivered over time and other energy related commodity such capacity generally delivered over time zecs recs or other ancillary service generally delivered at point in time concurrently power is generated for bundled power sale contract within the month following delivery to the customer competitive natural gas sale exelon sale of natural gas on full requirement basis or for an agreed upon volume to commercial and residential customer delivery of natural gas to the customer over time the natural gas is delivered and consumed by the customer within the month following delivery to the customer other competitive product and service exelon sale of other energy related product and service such long term construction and installation of energy efficiency asset and new power generating facility primarily to commercial and industrial customer construction and or installation of the asset for the customer revenue and associated cost are recognized throughout the contract term using an input method to measure progress towards completion within or day from the invoice date regulated electric and gas tariff sale the registrant sale of electricity and electricity distribution service the utility registrant and natural gas and gas distribution service peco bge and dpl to residential commercial industrial and governmental customer through regulated tariff rate approved by state regulatory commission delivery of electricity and or natural gas over time each day the electricity and or natural gas is delivered to customer tariff sale are generally considered daily contract customer can discontinue service at any time within the month following delivery of the electricity or natural gas to the customer regulated transmission service the registrant the utility registrant provide open access to their transmission facility to pjm which directs and control the operation of these transmission facility and accordingly compensates the utility registrant pursuant to filed tariff at cost based rate approved by ferc various including network integration transmission service nit ii scheduling system control and dispatch service and iii access to the wholesale grid over time utilizing output method to measure progress towards completion paid weekly by pjm __________ certain contract may contain limit on the total amount of revenue exelon is able to collect over the entire term of the contract in such case exelon estimate the total consideration expected to be received over the term of the contract net of contentscombined note to consolidated financial statement dollar in performance obligation such cost incurred and total labor hour expended the total amount of revenue that will be recognized is based on the agreed upon contractually stated amount the average contract registrant exelon comed peco bge pepco dpl and ace codms evaluate the performance of and allocate resource to comed peco bge pepco dpl and ace based on net income the basis for the reportable segment of generation is the integrated management of generation electricity business that is located in different geographic region and largely representative of the footprint of iso rto and or nerc region which utilize multiple supply source to provide electricity through various distribution channel wholesale and retail generation hedging strategy and risk metric are also aligned to these same generation early plant retirement exelon nuclear generationon august generation announced that it intended to permanently cease generation operation at byron in september and at dresden in november neither of these nuclear plant cleared in pjm capacity auction for the planning year held in may generation braidwood and lasalle nuclear plant in illinois did clear in the capacity auction but were also showing increased sign of economic distress on september the illinois public act wa signed into law by the governor of illinois clean energy law the clean energy law is designed to achieve carbon free power by to enable the state transition to clean energy economy among other thing the clean energy law authorized the ipa to procure up to million cmcs from qualifying nuclear plant for five year period beginning on june through may cmcs are credit for the carbon free attribute of eligible nuclear power plant in pjm the byron dresden and braidwood nuclear plant located in illinois participated in the cmc procurement process and were awarded contract that commit each plant to operate through may see note regulatory matter for additional information following enactment of the legislation generation announced on september that it ha reversed the previous decision to retire byron and dresden given the opportunity for additional revenue under the clean energy law in addition generation no longer considers the braidwood or lasalle nuclear plant to be at risk for premature retirement result of the decision to early retire byron and dresden exelon recognized certain one time charge in the third and fourth quarter of related to material and supply inventory reserve adjustment employee related cost including severance benefit cost and construction work in progress impairment among other item in addition there were ongoing annual financial impact stemming from shortening the expected economic useful life of these nuclear plant primarily related to accelerated depreciation of year ended december in exelon consolidated statement of operation and comprehensive income ndt fundsndt fund have been established for each generation station nuclear unit to satisfy generation nuclear decommissioning obligation required by the nrc and withdrawal from these fund for reason other than to pay for decommissioning are restricted pursuant to nrc requirement until all decommissioning activity have been completed generally ndt fund established for particular unit may not be used to fund the decommissioning obligation of any other unit the ndt fund associated with generation nuclear unit have been funded with amount collected from the previous owner and their respective utility customer peco is authorized to collect fund in revenue through regulated rate for decommissioning the former peco nuclear plant and these collection are scheduled through the operating life of these former peco plant the amount collected from peco customer are remitted to generation and deposited into the ndt fund for the unit for which fund are collected every five year peco file rate adjustment with the papuc that reflects peco calculation of the estimated amount needed to decommission each of the former peco unit based on updated fund balance and estimated decommissioning cost the rate adjustment is used to determine the amount collectible from peco customer on march peco filed it nuclear decommissioning cost adjustment with the papuc proposing an annual recovery from customer of approximately million on august the papuc approved the filing and the new rate became effective january any shortfall of fund necessary for decommissioning determined for each generating station unit are generally required to be funded by generation with the exception of shortfall for the current decommissioning activity at zion station where certain decommissioning activity have been transferred to third party see zion station decommissioning below and the former peco nuclear plant where through peco generation ha recourse to collect additional amount from peco customer related to shortfall of ndt fund for those unit subject to certain limitation and threshold prescribed by an order from the papuc that limit collection of amount associated with the first million of any shortfall of trust fund compared to decommissioning cost well of any additional shortfall on an aggregate basis for all former peco unit the initial million and up to of any additional shortfall would be borne by generation no recourse exists to collect additional amount from utility customer for any of generation other nuclear unit with respect to the former comed and former peco unit any fund remaining in the ndts after all decommissioning ha been completed are required to be refunded to comed or peco customer subject to certain limitation that allow sharing of excess fund with generation related to the former peco unit with respect to generation other nuclear unit generation retains any fund remaining after decommissioning however in connection with ceng acquisition of the nine mile point and ginna plant and settlement with certain regulatory agency certain condition pertaining to ndt fund apply that if met could possibly result in obligation to make payment to certain third party clawback for nine mile point and ginna the clawback provision are triggered only in the event that the required decommissioning activity are discontinued or not started or completed in timely manner in the event that the clawback provision are triggered for nine mile point then depending upon the triggering event an amount equal to of the total amount withdrawn from the fund for non decommissioning activity defined in the agreement or of any excess fund in offset in exelon consolidated statement of operation and comprehensive income regardless of whether the ndt fund are expected to exceed or fall short of the total estimated decommissioning obligation except per share data unless otherwise noted note asset asset impairment exelon exelon evaluates the carrying value of long lived asset or asset group for recoverability whenever event or change in circumstance indicate that the carrying value of those asset may not be recoverable indicator of impairment may include deteriorating business climate including but not limited to decline in energy price condition of the asset or plan to dispose of long lived asset significantly before the end of it useful life exelon determines if long lived asset or asset group are potentially impaired by comparing the undiscounted expected future cash flow to the carrying value when indicator of impairment exist when the undiscounted cash flow analysis indicates long lived asset or asset group may not be recoverable the amount of the impairment loss is determined by measuring the excess of the carrying amount of the long lived asset or asset group over it fair value the fair value analysis is primarily based on the income approach using significant unobservable input level including revenue and generation forecast projected capital and maintenance expenditure and discount rate variation in the assumption used could lead to different conclusion regarding the recoverability of an asset or asset group and thus could potentially result in material future impairment of exelon long lived asset new england asset groupin the third quarter of in conjunction with the retirement announcement of mystic unit and generation completed comprehensive review of the estimated undiscounted future cash flow of the new england asset group and concluded that the estimated undiscounted future cash flow and fair value of the new england asset group were le than their carrying value result pre tax impairment charge of million wa recorded in the third quarter of in operating and maintenance expense in exelon consolidated statement of operation and comprehensive income see note early plant retirement for additional information in the second quarter of an overall decline in the asset group portfolio value suggested that the carrying value of the new england asset group may be impaired generation completed comprehensive review of the estimated undiscounted future cash flow of the new england asset group and concluded that the carrying value wa not recoverable and that it fair value wa le than it carrying value result pre tax impairment charge of million wa recorded in the second quarter of in operating and maintenance expense in exelon consolidated statement of operation and comprehensive income contracted wind projectin the third quarter of significant long term operational issue anticipated for specific wind turbine technology suggested that the carrying value of contracted wind asset located in maryland and part of the crp joint venture may be impaired generation completed comprehensive review of the estimated undiscounted future cash flow and concluded that the carrying value of this contracted wind project wa not recoverable and that it fair value wa le than it carrying value result in the third quarter of pre tax impairment charge of million wa recorded in operating and maintenance expense million of which wa offset in net income attributable to noncontrolling interest in exelon consolidated statement of operation and comprehensive income equity method investment in certain distributed energy companiesin the third quarter of generation equity method investment in certain distributed energy company were fully impaired due to an other than temporary decline in market condition and underperforming project exelon recorded pre tax impairment charge of million in equity in loss of unconsolidated affiliate and an offsetting pre tax million in net income attributable to noncontrolling interest in the consolidated statement of operation and comprehensive income result generation accelerated the amortization of investment tax credit associated with these company and exelon recorded benefit of million in income tax the impairment charge and the accelerated amortization of investment tax credit resulted in net million decrease to exelon earnings see note variable interest entity for additional information intangible asset goodwill exelon comed phi pepco dpl and ace of contentscombined note to consolidated financial statement dollar in million except per share data unless otherwise noted note intangible assetsthe following table present the gross amount accumulated impairment loss and carrying amount of goodwill at exelon comed and phi of december and there were no addition or impairment during the year ended december and gross amountaccumulated impairment losscarrying amountexelon comed phi __________ reflects goodwill recorded in from the peco unicom merger predecessor parent company of comed reflects goodwill recorded in from the phi merger goodwill is not amortized but is subject to an assessment for impairment at least annually or more frequently if event occur or circumstance change that would more likely than not reduce the fair value of comed and phi reporting unit below their carrying amount reporting unit is an operating segment or one level below an operating segment known component and is the level at which goodwill is assessed for impairment component of an operating segment is reporting unit if the component constitutes business for which discrete financial information is available and it operating result are regularly reviewed by segment management comed ha single operating segment phi operating segment are pepco dpl and ace see note segment information for additional information there is no level below these operating segment for which operating result are regularly reviewed by segment management therefore the comed pepco dpl and ace operating segment are also considered reporting unit for goodwill impairment assessment purpose exelon and comed billion of goodwill ha been assigned entirely to the comed reporting unit while exelon and phi billion of goodwill ha been assigned to the pepco dpl and ace reporting unit in the amount of billion billion and billion respectively entity assessing goodwill for impairment have the option of first performing qualitative assessment to determine whether quantitative assessment is necessary part of the qualitative assessment exelon comed and phi evaluate among other thing management best estimate of projected operating and capital cash flow for their business outcome of recent regulatory proceeding change in certain market condition including the discount rate and regulated utility peer ebitda multiple and the passing margin from their last quantitative assessment performed if an entity bypass the qualitative assessment quantitative fair value based assessment is performed which compare the fair value of the reporting unit to it carrying amount including goodwill if the carrying amount of the reporting unit exceeds it fair value the entity recognizes an impairment charge which is limited to the amount of goodwill allocated to the reporting unit application of the goodwill impairment assessment requires management judgment including the identification of reporting unit and determining the fair value of the reporting unit which management estimate using weighted combination of discounted cash flow analysis and market multiple analysis significant assumption used in these fair value analysis include discount and growth rate utility sector market performance and transaction projected operating and capital cash flow for comed pepco dpl and ace business and the fair value of debt and goodwill impairment assessment comed and phi qualitatively determined that it wa more likely than not that the fair value of their reporting unit exceeded their carrying value and therefore did not perform quantitative assessment of november and the last quantitative assessment performed were of november for comed and november for phi while the annual assessment indicated no impairment certain assumption used to estimate reporting unit fair value are highly sensitive to change adverse regulatory action or change in significant assumption could potentially result in future impairment of exelon comed and phi goodwill which could be material other taxesallocation of tax benefit all registrant the utility registrant are party to an agreement with exelon and other subsidiary of exelon that provides for the allocation of consolidated tax liability and benefit tax sharing agreement the tax sharing agreement provides that each party is allocated an amount of tax similar to that which would be owed had the party been separately subject to tax in addition any net federal and state benefit attributable to exelon are reallocated to the other registrant that allocation is treated contribution from exelon to the party receiving the benefit the liability hedging investment strategy for it qualified pension plan that ha reduced the volatility of it pension asset relative to it pension liability exelon is likely to continue to gradually increase the liability hedging portfolio the funded status of it plan improves the overall objective is to achieve attractive risk adjusted return that will balance the liquidity requirement of the plan liability while striving to minimize the risk of significant loss trust asset for exelon opeb plan are managed in diversified investment strategy that prioritizes maximizing liquidity and return benefitsdefined contribution saving plan all registrant the registrant participate in various defined contribution saving plan that are sponsored by exelon the plan are qualified under applicable section of the irc and allow employee to contribute portion of their pre tax and or after tax income in accordance with specified guideline all registrant match percentage of the employee contribution up to certain limit the following table present matching contribution to the saving plan for the year ended december and for the year ended december derivative financial instrument all registrant the registrant use derivative instrument to manage commodity price risk interest rate risk and foreign exchange risk related to ongoing business operation authoritative guidance requires that derivative instrument be recognized either asset or liability at fair value with change in fair value of the derivative recognized in earnings immediately other accounting treatment are available through special election and designation provided they meet specific restrictive criterion both at the time of designation and on an ongoing basis these alternative permissible accounting treatment include npns cash flow hedge and fair value hedge generation and comed derivative economic hedge related to commodity referred to economic hedge are recorded at fair value through earnings at exelon for generation economic hedge and for comed economic hedge are offset by corresponding regulatory asset or liability for all npns derivative instrument account receivable or account payable are recorded when derivative settle and revenue or expense is recognized in earnings the underlying physical commodity is sold or consumed authoritative guidance about offsetting asset and liability requires the fair value of derivative instrument to be shown in the combined note to consolidated financial statement on gross basis even when the derivative instrument are subject to legally enforceable master netting agreement and qualify for net presentation in the consolidated balance sheet master netting agreement is an agreement between two counterparties that may have derivative and non derivative contract with each other providing for the net settlement of all referenced contract via one payment stream which take place the contract deliver when collateral is requested or in the event of default in the table below which present fair value balance generation energy related economic hedge and proprietary trading derivative are shown gross the impact of the netting of fair value balance with the same counterparty that are subject to legally enforceable master netting agreement well netting of cash collateral including margin on exchange position is aggregated in the collateral and netting column generation and comed use of cash collateral is generally unrestricted unless generation or comed are downgraded below investment grade cash collateral held by peco bge pepco dpl and ace must be deposited in an unaffiliated major commercial bank or foreign bank with branch office that meet certain qualification commodity price risk all registrant each of the registrant employ established policy and procedure to manage their risk associated with market fluctuation in commodity price by entering into physical and financial derivative contract including swap future forward option and short term and long term commitment to purchase and sell energy and commodity product the registrant believe these instrument which are either determined to be non derivative or classified economic hedge mitigate exposure to fluctuation in commodity price generation to the extent the amount of energy generation produce differs from the amount of energy it ha contracted to sell exelon is exposed to market fluctuation in the price of electricity fossil fuel and other commodity within exelon generation ha the most exposure to commodity price risk such generation of contentscombined note to consolidated financial statement dollar in million except per share data unless otherwise noted note derivative financial instrumentsuses variety of derivative and non derivative instrument to manage the commodity price risk of it electric generation facility including power and gas sale fuel and power purchase natural gas transportation and pipeline capacity agreement and other energy related product marketed and purchased to manage these risk generation may enter into fixed price derivative or non derivative contract to hedge the variability in future cash flow from expected sale of power and gas and purchase of power and fuel the objective for executing such hedge include fixing the price for portion of anticipated future electricity sale at level that provides an acceptable return generation is also exposed to difference between the locational settlement price of certain economic hedge and the hedged generating unit this price difference is actively managed through other instrument which include derivative congestion product whose change in fair value are recognized in earnings each period and auction revenue right which are accounted for on an accrual basis additionally generation is exposed to certain market risk through it proprietary trading activity the proprietary trading activity are complement to generation energy marketing portfolio but represent small portion of generation overall energy marketing activity and are subject to limit established by exelon rmc utility registrant the utility registrant procure electric and natural gas supply through competitive procurement process approved by each of the respective state utility commission the utility registrant hedging program are intended to reduce exposure to energy and natural gas price volatility and have no direct earnings impact the cost are fully recovered from customer through regulatory approved recovery mechanism the following table provides summary of the utility instrumentsin general increase and decrease in forward market price have positive and negative impact respectively on generation owned and contracted generation position that have not been hedged for merchant revenue not already hedged via comprehensive state program such the cmc in illinois we utilize three year ratable sale plan to align our hedging strategy with our financial objective the prompt three year merchant revenue are hedged on an approximate rolling basis we may also enter into transaction that are outside of this ratable hedging program proprietary trading commodity price risk generation also executes commodity derivative for proprietary trading purpose proprietary trading includes all contract executed with the intent of benefiting from shift or change in market price opposed to those executed with the intent of hedging or managing risk gain and loss associated with proprietary trading are reported operating revenue in exelon consolidated statement of operation and comprehensive income and are included in the net fair value change related to derivative line in the consolidated statement of cash flow for the year ended december and net pre tax commodity mark to market gain and loss for exelon were not material the utility registrant do not execute derivative for proprietary trading purpose interest rate and foreign exchange risk exelon generation utilizes interest rate swap to manage it interest rate exposure and foreign currency derivative to manage foreign exchange rate exposure associated with international commodity purchase in currency other than dollar both of which are treated economic hedge the notional amount were million and million for exelon of december and respectively the mark to market derivative asset and liability of december and and the mark to market gain and loss for the year ended december and were not material for exelon credit risk all registrant the registrant would be exposed to credit related loss in the event of non performance by counterparties on executed derivative instrument the credit exposure of derivative contract before collateral is represented by the fair value of contract at the reporting date generation for commodity derivative generation enters into enabling agreement that allow for payment netting with it counterparties which reduces generation exposure to counterparty risk by providing for the offset of amount payable to the counterparty against amount receivable from the counterparty typically each enabling agreement is for specific commodity and so with respect to each individual counterparty netting is limited to transaction involving that specific commodity product except where master netting agreement exist with counterparty that allow for cross product netting in addition to payment netting language in the enabling agreement generation credit department establishes credit limit margining threshold and collateral requirement for each counterparty which are defined in the derivative contract counterparty credit limit are based on an internal credit review process that considers variety of factor including the result of scoring model leverage liquidity profitability credit rating by credit rating agency and risk management capability to the extent that counterparty margining threshold are exceeded the counterparty is required to post collateral with generation specified in each enabling agreement generation credit department monitor current and forward credit exposure to counterparties and their affiliate both on an individual and an aggregate basis the following table provide information on generation credit exposure for all derivative instrument npns and payable and receivables net of collateral and instrument that are subject to master netting agreement of december the table further delineate that exposure by credit rating of the counterparties and provide guidance on the concentration of credit risk to individual counterparties the amount in the table below exclude credit risk exposure from individual retail counterparties nuclear fuel procurement contract and exposure through rtos isos nymex ice nasdaq ngx and nodal commodity exchange and total __________ of december credit collateral held from counterparties where generation had credit exposure included million of cash and million of letter of credit the credit collateral doe not include non liquid collateral utility registrant the utility registrant have contract to procure electric and natural gas supply that provide supplier with certain amount of unsecured credit if the exposure on the supply contract exceeds the amount of unsecured credit the supplier may be required to post collateral the net credit exposure is mitigated primarily by the ability to recover procurement cost through customer rate of december the amount of cash collateral held with external counterparties by comed and dpl wa million and million respectively which is recorded in other current liability in comed and dpl consolidated balance sheet the amount for peco bge pepco and ace of december and for the utility registrant of december are not material credit risk related contingent feature all registrant generation part of the normal course of business generation routinely enters into physically or financially settled contract for the purchase and sale of electric capacity electricity fuel emission allowance and other energy related product certain of generation derivative instrument contain provision that require generation to post collateral generation also enters into commodity transaction on exchange where the exchange act the counterparty to each trade transaction on the exchange must adhere to comprehensive collateral and margining requirement this collateral may be posted in the form of cash or credit support with threshold contingent upon generation credit rating from each of the major credit rating agency the collateral and credit support requirement vary by contract and by counterparty these credit risk related contingent feature stipulate that if generation were to be downgraded or lose it investment grade credit rating based on it senior unsecured debt rating it would be required to provide additional collateral this incremental collateral requirement allows for the offsetting of derivative instrument that are asset with the same counterparty where the contractual right of offset exists under applicable master netting agreement in the absence of expressly agreed to provision that specify the collateral that must be provided collateral requested will be function of the fact and circumstance of the situation at the time of the demand in this case generation belief an amount of several month of future payment capacity payment rather than calculation of fair value is the best estimate for the contingent collateral obligation which ha been factored into the disclosure below the aggregate fair value of all derivative instrument with credit risk related contingent feature in liability position that are not fully collateralized excluding transaction on the exchange that are fully collateralized is in the event of default if specific project financing entity doe not maintain compliance with it specific nonrecourse debt financing covenant there could be requirement to accelerate repayment of the associated debt or other borrowing earlier than the stated maturity date in these instance if such repayment wa not satisfied the lender or security holder would generally have right to foreclose information on interest rate swap fair value of financial asset and liability all registrant exelon measure and classifies fair value measurement in accordance with the hierarchy defined by gaap the hierarchy prioritizes the input to valuation technique used to measure fair value into three level follows level quoted price unadjusted in active market for identical asset or liability that the registrant have the ability to liquidate of the reporting date level input other than quoted price included within level that are directly observable for the asset or liability or indirectly observable through corroboration with observable market data level unobservable input such internally developed pricing model or third party valuation for the asset or liability due to little or no market activity for the asset or liability of contentscombined note to consolidated financial statement dollar in million except per share data unless otherwise noted note fair value of financial asset and liabilitiesfair value of financial liability recorded at amortized costthe following table present the carrying amount and fair value of the registrant short term liability long term debt consolidated financial statement dollar in million except per share data unless otherwise noted note fair value of financial asset and liabilitiesexelon us the following method and assumption to estimate fair value of financial liability recorded at carrying cost typelevelregistrantsvaluationlong term debt including amount due within one yeartaxable debt fair value is determined by valuation model that is based on conventional discounted cash flow methodology and utilizes assumption of current market pricing curve exelon obtains credit spread based on trade of existing exelon debt security well other issuer in the utility sector with similar credit rating the yield are then converted into discount rate of various tenor that are used for discounting the respective cash flow of the same tenor for each bond or note variable rate financing dpldebt rate are reset on regular basis and the carrying value approximates fair value taxable private placement debt pepco dpl acerates are obtained similar to the process for taxable debt security due to low trading volume and qualitative factor such market condition low volume of investor and investor demand these debt security are level government backed fixed rate project financing fair value is similar to the process for taxable debt security due to the lack of market trading data on similar debt the discount rate are derived based on the original loan interest rate spread to the applicable treasury rate well current market curve derived from government backed security non government backed fixed rate nonrecourse pepcofair value is based on market and quoted price for it own and other nonrecourse debt with similar risk profile given the low trading volume in the nonrecourse debt market the price quote used to determine fair value will reflect certain qualitative factor such market condition investor demand new development that might significantly impact the project cash flow or off taker credit and other circumstance related to the project long term debt to financing trustslong term debt to financing comed pecofair value is based on publicly traded security issued by the financing trust due to low trading volume of these security and qualitative factor such market condition investor demand and circumstance related to each issue this debt is classified level snf obligationsnf exelonthe carrying amount is derived from contract with the doe to provide for disposal of snf from certain of exelon nuclear generating station see note commitment and contingency for further detail when determining the fair value of the obligation the future carrying amount of the snf obligation is calculated by compounding the current book value of the snf obligation at the week treasury rate the compounded obligation amount is discounted back to present value using exelon discount rate which is calculated using the same methodology described above for the taxable debt security and an estimated maturity contentscombined note to consolidated financial statement dollar in million except per share data unless otherwise noted note fair value of financial asset and liabilitiesvaluation technique used to determine fair valuecash equivalent all registrant investment with original maturity of three month or le when purchased including mutual and money market fund are considered cash equivalent the fair value are based on observable market price and therefore are included in the recurring fair value measurement hierarchy level ndt fund investment exelon the trust fund investment have been established to satisfy generation nuclear decommissioning obligation required by the nrc the ndt fund hold debt and equity security directly and indirectly through commingled fund and mutual fund which are included in equity and fixed income generation ndt fund investment policy outline investment guideline for the trust and limit the trust fund exposure to investment in highly illiquid market and other alternative investment including private credit private equity and real estate investment with maturity of three month or le when purchased including certain short term fixed income security are considered cash equivalent and included in the recurring fair value measurement hierarchy level or level equity these investment consist of individually held equity security equity mutual fund and equity commingled fund in domestic and foreign market with respect to individually held equity security the trustee obtain price from pricing service whose price are generally obtained from direct feed from market exchange which exelon is able to independently corroborate equity security held individually including real estate investment trust right and warrant are primarily traded on exchange that contain only actively traded security due to the volume trading requirement imposed by these exchange the equity security that are held directly by the trust fund are valued based on quoted price in active market and categorized level certain equity security have been categorized level because they are based on evaluated price that reflect observable market information such actual trade information or similar security certain private placement equity security are categorized level because they are not publicly traded and are priced using significant unobservable input equity commingled fund and mutual fund are maintained by investment company and fund investment are held in accordance with stated set of fund objective the value of some of these fund are publicly quoted for mutual fund which are publicly quoted the fund are valued based on quoted price in active market and have been categorized level for equity commingled fund and mutual fund which are not publicly quoted the fund administrator value the fund using the nav per fund share derived from the quoted price in active market on the underlying security and are not classified within the fair value hierarchy these investment can typically be redeemed monthly or more frequently with or le day of notice and without further restriction fixed income for fixed income security which consist primarily of corporate debt security government security foreign government security municipal bond asset and mortgage backed security commingled fund mutual fund and derivative instrument the trustee obtain multiple price from pricing vendor whenever possible which enables cross provider validation in addition to check for unusual daily movement primary price source is identified based on asset type class or issue for each security with respect to individually held fixed income security the trustee monitor price supplied by pricing service and may use supplemental price source or change the primary price source of given security if the portfolio manager challenge an assigned price and the trustee determine that another price source is considered to be preferable exelon ha obtained an understanding of how these price are derived including the nature and observability of the input used in deriving such price additionally exelon selectively corroborates the fair value of security by comparison to other market based price source investment in treasury security have been categorized level because they trade in highly liquid and transparent market certain private placement fixed income security have been categorized level because they are priced using certain significant unobservable input and are typically illiquid the remaining fixed income security including certain other fixed income investment are based on evaluated price that reflect observable market information such actual trade information of similar security adjusted for observable difference and are categorized level other fixed income investment primarily consist of fixed income commingled fund and mutual fund which are maintained by investment company and hold fund investment in accordance with stated set of fund objective the value of some of these fund are publicly quoted for mutual fund which are publicly quoted the fund are valued based on quoted price in active market and have been categorized level for fixed income commingled fund and mutual fund which are not publicly quoted the fund administrator value the fund using the nav per fund share derived from the quoted price in active market of the underlying security of contentscombined note to consolidated financial statement dollar in million except per share data unless otherwise noted note fair value of financial asset and liabilitiesand are not classified within the fair value hierarchy these investment typically can be redeemed monthly or more frequently with or le day of notice and without further restriction derivative instrument these instrument consisting primarily of future and swap to manage risk are recorded at fair value over the counter derivative are valued daily based on quoted price in active market and trade in open market and have been categorized level derivative instrument other than over the counter derivative are valued based on external price data of comparable security and have been categorized level private credit private credit investment primarily consist of investment in private debt strategy these investment are generally le liquid asset with an underlying term of to year and are intended to be held to maturity the fair value of these investment is determined by the fund manager or administrator using combination of valuation model including cost model market model and income model and typically can not be redeemed until maturity of the term loan private credit investment held directly by exelon are categorized level because they are based largely on input that are unobservable and utilize complex valuation model for managed private credit fund the fair value is determined using combination of valuation model including cost model market model and income model and typically can not be redeemed until maturity of the term loan managed private credit fund investment are not classified within the fair value hierarchy because their fair value is determined using nav or it equivalent practical expedient private equity these investment include those in limited partnership that invest in operating company that are not publicly traded on stock exchange such leveraged buyout growth capital venture capital distressed investment and investment in natural resource these investment typically can not be redeemed and are generally liquidated over period of to year from the initial investment date which is based on exelon understanding of the investment fund private equity valuation are reported by the fund manager and are based on the valuation of the underlying investment which include unobservable input such cost operating result discounted future cash flow and market based comparable data these valuation input are unobservable the fair value of private equity investment is determined using nav or it equivalent practical expedient and therefore these investment are not classified within the fair value hierarchy real estate these investment are fund with direct investment in pool of real estate property these fund are reported by the fund manager and are generally based on independent appraisal of the underlying investment from source with professional qualification typically using combination of market based comparable data and discounted cash flow these valuation input are unobservable certain real estate investment can not be redeemed and are generally liquidated over period of to year from the initial investment date which is based on exelon understanding of the investment fund the remaining liquid real estate investment are generally redeemable from the investment vehicle quarterly with to day of notice the fair value of real estate investment is determined using nav or it equivalent practical expedient and therefore these investment are not classified within the fair value hierarchy exelon evaluated it ndt portfolio for the existence of significant concentration of credit risk of december type of concentration that were evaluated include but are not limited to investment concentration in single entity type of industry foreign country and individual fund of december there were no significant concentration generally defined greater than percent of risk in the ndt asset see note asset retirement obligation for additional information on the ndt fund investment see note retirement benefit for the valuation obligation all registrant the registrant deferred compensation plan allow participant to defer certain cash compensation into notional investment account the registrant include such plan in other current and noncurrent liability in their consolidated balance sheet the value of the registrant deferred compensation obligation is based on the market value of the participant notional investment account the underlying notional investment are comprised primarily of equity mutual fund commingled fund and fixed income security which are based on directly and indirectly observable market price investment in equity exelon exelon hold certain investment in equity security with readily determinable fair value in addition to those held within the ndt fund these equity security are valued based on quoted price in active market and are categorized level deferred purchase price consideration exelon exelon ha dpp consideration for the sale of certain receivables of retail electricity this amount is valued based on the sale price of the receivables net of allowance for credit loss based on account receivable aging historical experience coupled with specific identification through credit monitoring process which considers current condition and forward looking information such industry trend macroeconomic factor change in the regulatory environment external credit rating publicly available news payment status payment history and the exercise of collateral call since the dpp consideration is based on the sale price of the receivables it is categorized level in the fair value hierarchy see note account receivable for additional information on the sale of certain receivables mark to market derivative exelon and comed derivative contract are traded in both exchange based and non exchange based market exchange based derivative that are valued using unadjusted quoted price in active market are categorized in level in the fair value hierarchy certain derivative pricing is verified using indicative price quotation available through broker or over the counter on line exchange and are categorized in level these price quotation reflect the average of the bid ask mid point price and are obtained from source that the registrant believe provide the most liquid market for the commodity the price quotation are reviewed and corroborated to ensure the price are observable and representative of an orderly transaction between market participant this includes consideration of actual transaction volume market delivery point bid ask spread and contract duration the remainder of derivative contract are valued using the black model an industry standard option valuation model the black model take into account input such contract term including maturity and market parameter including assumption of the future price of energy interest rate volatility credit worthiness and credit spread for derivative that trade in liquid market such generic forward swap and option model input are generally observable such instrument are categorized in level the registrant derivative are predominantly at liquid trading point for derivative that trade in le liquid market with limited pricing information model input generally would include both observable and unobservable input these valuation may include an estimated basis adjustment from an illiquid trading point to liquid trading point for which active price quotation are available such instrument are categorized in level for valuation that include both observable and unobservable input if the unobservable input is determined to be significant to the overall input the entire valuation is categorized in level this includes derivative valued using indicative price quotation whose contract tenure extends into unobservable period in instance where observable data is unavailable consideration is given to the assumption that market participant would use in valuing the asset or liability this includes assumption about market risk such liquidity volatility and contract duration such instrument are categorized in level the model input generally are not observable forward price curve for the power market utilized by the front office to manage the portfolio are reviewed and verified by the middle office and used for financial reporting by the back office the registrant consider credit and of contentscombined note to consolidated financial statement dollar in million except per share data unless otherwise noted note fair value of financial asset and liabilitiesnonperformance risk in the valuation of derivative contract categorized in level and including both historical and current market data in their assessment of credit and nonperformance risk by counterparty due to master netting agreement and collateral posting requirement the impact of credit and nonperformance risk were not material to the financial statement disclosed below is detail surrounding the registrant significant level valuation the calculated fair value includes marketability discount for margining provision and other attribute the level balance related to generation generally consists of forward sale and purchase of power and natural gas and certain transmission congestion contract exelon utilizes various input and factor including market data and assumption that market participant would use in pricing asset or liability well assumption about the risk inherent in the input to the valuation technique the input and factor include forward commodity price commodity price volatility contractual volume delivery location interest rate credit quality of counterparties and credit enhancement for commodity derivative the primary input to the valuation model is the forward commodity price curve for each instrument forward commodity price curve are derived by risk management for liquid location and by the trader and portfolio manager for illiquid location all location are reviewed and verified by risk management considering published exchange transaction price executed bilateral transaction broker quote and other observable or public data source the relevant forward commodity curve used to value each of the derivative depends on number of factor including commodity type delivery location and delivery period price volatility varies by commodity and location when appropriate exelon discount future cash flow using risk free interest rate with adjustment to reflect the credit quality of each counterparty for asset and generation own credit quality for liability the level of observability of forward commodity price varies generally due to the delivery location and delivery period certain delivery location including pjm west hub for power and henry hub for natural gas are more liquid and price are observable for up to three year in the future the observability period of volatility is generally shorter than the underlying power curve used in option valuation the forward curve for le liquid location is estimated by using the forward curve from the liquid location and applying spread to represent the cost to transport the commodity to the delivery location this spread doe not typically represent majority of the instrument market price result the change in fair value is closely tied to liquid market movement and not change in the applied spread the change in fair value associated with change in the spread is generally immaterial an average spread calculated across all level power and gas delivery location is approximately and for power and natural gas respectively many of the commodity derivative are short term in nature and thus majority of the fair value may be based on observable input even though the contract whole must be classified level on december comed entered into several year floating to fixed energy swap contract with unaffiliated supplier for the procurement of long term renewable energy and associated recs see note derivative financial instrument for additional information the fair value of these swap ha been designated level valuation due to the long tenure of the position and internal modeling assumption the modeling assumption include using natural gas heat rate to project long term forward power curve adjusted by renewable factor that incorporates time of day and seasonality factor to reflect accurate renewable energy pricing in addition marketability reserve are applied to the position based on the tenor and supplier risk see note derivative financial instrument for additional information on mark to market and for option is price volatility increase decrease in the forward commodity price in isolation would result in significantly higher lower fair value for long position contract that give exelon the obligation or option to purchase commodity with offsetting impact to short position contract that give exelon the obligation or right to sell commodity increase decrease in volatility would increase decrease the value for the holder of the option writer of the option generally change in the estimate of forward commodity price is unrelated to change in the estimate of volatility of price an increase to the reserve listed above would decrease the fair value of the position an increase to the heat rate or renewable factor would increase the fair value accordingly generally interrelationship exist between market price of natural gas and power such an increase in natural gas pricing would potentially have similar impact on forward power market of contentscombined note to consolidated financial statement dollar in million except per share data unless otherwise noted note commitment and contingenciesnuclear insurance exelon generation is subject to liability property damage and other risk associated with major incident at any of it nuclear station generation ha mitigated it financial exposure to these risk through insurance and other industry risk sharing provision the price anderson act wa enacted to ensure the availability of fund for public liability claim arising from an incident at any of the licensed nuclear facility and to limit the liability of nuclear reactor owner for such claim from any single incident of december the current liability limit per incident is billion and is subject to change to account for the effect of inflation and change in the number of licensed reactor at least once every five year with the last adjustment effective november in accordance with the price anderson act generation maintains financial protection at level equal to the amount of liability insurance available from private source through the purchase of private nuclear energy liability insurance for public liability claim that could arise in the event of an incident effective january the required amount of nuclear energy liability insurance purchased is million for each operating site claim exceeding that amount are covered through mandatory participation in financial protection pool required by the price anderson act which provides the additional billion per incident in fund available for public liability claim participation in this secondary financial protection pool requires the operator of each reactor to fund it proportionate share of cost for any single incident that exceeds the primary layer of financial protection generation share of this secondary layer would be approximately billion however any amount payable under this secondary layer would be capped at million per year in addition the congress could impose revenue raising measure on the nuclear industry to pay public liability claim exceeding the billion limit for single incident generation is required each year to report to the nrc the current level and source of property insurance that demonstrates generation posse sufficient financial resource to stabilize and decontaminate reactor and reactor station site in the event of an accident the property insurance maintained for each facility is currently provided through insurance policy purchased from neil an industry mutual insurance company of which generation is member neil may declare distribution to it member result of favorable operating experience in recent year neil ha made distribution to it member generation portion of the annual distribution declared by neil is estimated to be million for and wa million and million for and respectively the distribution were recorded reduction to operating and maintenance expense within exelon consolidated statement of operation and comprehensive income spent nuclear fuel obligation exelon under the nwpa the doe is responsible for the development of geologic repository for and the disposal of snf and high level radioactive waste required by the nwpa generation is party to contract with the doe standard contract to provide for disposal of snf from generation nuclear generating station in accordance with the nwpa and the standard contract generation historically had paid the doe one mill per kwh of net nuclear generation for the cost of snf disposal due to the lack of viable disposal program the doe reduced the snf disposal fee to zero in may until new fee structure is in effect exelon and generation will not accrue any further cost related to snf disposal fee this fee may be adjusted prospectively to ensure full cost recovery generation currently assumes the doe will begin accepting snf in and us that date for purpose of estimating the nuclear decommissioning asset retirement obligation the snf acceptance date assumption is based on management estimate of the amount of time required for doe to select site location and develop the necessary infrastructure for long term snf storage the nwpa and the standard contract required the doe to begin taking possession of snf generated by nuclear generating unit by no later than january the doe however failed to meet that deadline and it performance is expected to be delayed significantly in august generation and the doj in close consultation with the doe reached settlement under which the government agreed to reimburse generation subject to certain damage limitation based on the extent of the government breach for cost associated with storage of snf at generation nuclear station pending the doe fulfillment of it obligation calvert cliff ginna and nine mile point each have separate settlement agreement in place with the doe which were of contentscombined note to consolidated financial statement dollar in million except andremediationexelon phi of contentscombined note to consolidated financial statement dollar in million except per share data unless otherwise noted note commitment and contingenciescotter corporation exelon the epa ha advised cotter corporation cotter former comed subsidiary that it is potentially liable in connection with radiological contamination at site known the west lake landfill in missouri in comed sold cotter to an unaffiliated third party part of the sale comed agreed to indemnify cotter for any liability arising in connection with the west lake landfill in connection with exelon corporate restructuring this responsibility to indemnify cotter wa transferred to generation including cotter there are three prps participating in the west lake landfill remediation proceeding investigation by generation ha identified number of other party who also may be prps and could be liable to contribute to the final remedy further investigation is ongoing in september the epa issued it record of decision amendment roda for the selection of final remedy the roda modified the remedy previously selected by epa in it record of decision rod while the rod required only that the radiological material and other waste at the site be capped the roda requires partial excavation of the radiological material in addition to the previously selected capping remedy the roda also allows for variation in depth of excavation depending on radiological concentration the epa and the prps have entered into consent agreement to perform the remedial design which is expected to be completed in late in march the prps received special notice letter from the epa to perform the remedial action work on october cotter generation indemnitee provided non binding good faith offer to conduct or finance portion of the remedy subject to certain condition the total estimated cost of the remedy taking into account the current epa technical requirement and the total cost expected to be incurred collectively by the prps in fully executing the remedy is approximately million including cost escalation on an undiscounted basis which would be allocated among the final group of prps exelon ha determined that loss associated with the epa partial excavation and enhanced landfill cover remedy is probable and ha recorded liability included in the table above that reflects management best estimate of cotter allocable share of the ultimate cost given the joint and several nature of this liability the magnitude of exelon ultimate liability will depend on the actual cost incurred to implement the required remedy well on the nature and term of any cost sharing arrangement with the final group of prps therefore it is reasonably possible that the ultimate cost and cotter associated allocable share could differ significantly once these uncertainty are resolved one of the other prps ha indicated it will be making contribution claim against cotter for cost that it ha incurred to prevent subsurface fire from spreading to those area of the west lake landfill where radiological material are believed to have been disposed at this time exelon doe not posse sufficient information to ass this claim and therefore are unable to estimate range of loss if any such no liability ha been recorded for the potential contribution claim in january the prps were advised by the epa that it will begin an additional investigation and evaluation of groundwater condition at the west lake landfill in september the prps agreed to an administrative settlement agreement and order on consent for the performance by the prps of the groundwater remedial investigation and feasibility study ri the purpose of this ri is to define the nature and extent of any groundwater contamination from the west lake landfill site and evaluate remedial alternative exelon estimate the undiscounted cost for the groundwater ri to be approximately million exelon determined loss associated with the ri is probable and ha recorded liability included in the table above that reflects management best estimate of cotter allocable share of the cost among the prps at this time exelon can not predict the likelihood or the extent to which if any remediation activity may be required and therefore can not estimate reasonably possible range of loss for response cost beyond those associated with the ri component in august cotter wa notified by the doj that cotter is considered prp with respect to the government clean up cost for contamination attributable to low level radioactive residue at former storage and reprocessing facility named latty avenue near st louis missouri the latty avenue site is included in comed now generation indemnification responsibility discussed above part of the sale of cotter the radioactive residue had been generated initially in connection with the processing of uranium ore part of the government manhattan project cotter purchased the residue in for initial processing at the latty avenue facility for the subsequent extraction of uranium and metal in the nrc found that the latty avenue site had radiation level exceeding nrc criterion for decontamination of land area latty avenue wa investigated and remediated by the united state army corp of engineer pursuant to funding under fusrap formerly utilized site remedial action program pursuant to series of annual agreement since the doj and the prps have tolled the statute of limitation until february so that settlement discussion can proceed on august the doj advised cotter and the other prps that it is seeking
