quarter of exelon ha determined that loss associated with this matter is probable under it indemnification agreement with cotter and ha recorded an estimated liability which is included in the table above benning road site exelon phi and pepco in september phi received letter from epa identifying the benning road site one of six land based site potentially contributing to contamination of the lower anacostia river portion of the site wa formerly the location of pepco energy service electric generating facility which wa deactivated in june the remaining portion of the site consists of pepco transmission and distribution service center that remains in operation in december the district court for the district of columbia approved consent decree entered into by pepco and pepco energy service with the doee which requires pepco and pepco energy service to conduct ri for the benning road site and an approximately to acre portion of the adjacent anacostia river since pepco and pepco energy service now generation pursuant to exelon acquisition of phi have been performing ri work and have submitted multiple draft ri report to the doee in september pepco and generation issued draft final ri report which doee approved on february pepco and generation are developing to evaluate possible remedial alternative for submission to doee the court ha established schedule for completion of the and approval by the doee by september after completion and approval of the doee will prepare proposed plan for public comment and then issue rod identifying any further response action determined to be necessary exelon phi and pepco have determined that loss associated with this matter is probable and have accrued an estimated liability which is included in the table above anacostia river tidal reach exelon phi and pepco contemporaneous with the benning road site ri being performed by pepco and generation doee and national park service np have been conducting separate ri focused on the entire tidal reach of the anacostia river extending from just north of the maryland district of columbia boundary line to the confluence of the anacostia and potomac river the river wide ri incorporated the result of the river sampling performed by pepco and pepco energy service part of the benning ri well similar sampling effort conducted by owner of other site adjacent to this segment of the river and supplemental river sampling conducted by doee contractor in april doee released draft ri report for public review and comment pepco submitted written comment to the draft ri and participated in public hearing pepco ha determined that it is probable that cost for remediation will be incurred and recorded liability in the third quarter for management best estimate of it share of those cost on september doee released it interim rod the interim rod reflects an adaptive management approach which will require several identified hot spot in the river to be addressed first while continuing to conduct study and to monitor the river to evaluate improvement and determine potential future remediation plan the adaptive management process chosen by doee is le intrusive provides more long term environmental certainty is le costly and allows for site specific remediation plan already underway including the plan for the benning road site to proceed to conclusion pepco concluded that incremental exposure remains reasonably possible but management can not reasonably estimate range of loss beyond the amount recorded which are included in the table above on july doee and np held virtual meeting with the prp in response to general notice letter sent by each agency inviting the prp to participate in discussion which pepco attended in addition to the activity associated with the remedial process outlined above cercla separately requires federal and state including washington natural resource trustee federal or state agency designated by the president or the relevant state respectively or indian tribe to conduct an assessment of any damage to natural resource within their jurisdiction result of the contamination that is being remediated the trustee can seek compensation from responsible party for such damage including restoration cost during the second quarter of pepco became aware that the trustee are in the beginning stage of natural resource damage nrd assessment process that often take many year beyond the remedial decision to complete pepco ha concluded that loss associated with the eventual nrd assessment is reasonably possible due to the very early stage subpoena in the second quarter of from the attorney office for the northern district of illinois usao requiring production of information concerning their lobbying activity in the state of illinois on october exelon and comed received second grand jury subpoena from the usao requiring production of record of any communication with certain individual and entity on october the sec notified exelon and comed that it had also opened an investigation into their lobbying activity on july comed entered into dpa with the usao to resolve the usao investigation under the dpa the usao filed single charge alleging that comed improperly gave and offered to give job vendor subcontract and payment associated with those job and subcontract for the benefit of the speaker of the illinois house of representative and the speaker associate with the intent to influence the speaker action regarding legislation affecting comed interest the dpa provides that the usao will defer any prosecution of such charge and any other criminal or civil case against comed in connection with the matter identified therein for three year period subject to certain obligation of comed including payment to the treasury of million which wa paid in november exelon wa not made party to the dpa and therefore the investigation by the usao into exelon activity ended with no charge being brought against exelon the sec investigation remains ongoing and exelon and comed have cooperated fully and intend to continue to cooperate fully with the sec exelon and comed can not predict the outcome of the sec investigation no loss contingency ha been reflected in exelon and comed consolidated financial statement with respect to the sec investigation this contingency is neither probable nor reasonably estimable at this time subsequent to exelon announcing the receipt of the subpoena various lawsuit were filed and various demand letter were received related to the subject of the subpoena the conduct described in the dpa and the sec investigation including four putative class action lawsuit against comed and exelon were filed in federal court on behalf of comed customer in the third quarter of probable nor reasonably estimable at this time general all registrant the registrant are involved in various other litigation matter that are being defended and handled in the ordinary course of business the assessment of whether loss is probable or reasonably possible and whether the loss or range of loss is estimable often involves series of complex judgment about future event the registrant maintain accrual for such loss that are probable of being incurred and subject to reasonable estimation management is sometimes unable to estimate an amount or range of reasonably possible loss particularly where the damage sought are indeterminate the proceeding are in the early stage or the matter involve novel or unsettled legal theory in such case there is considerable uncertainty regarding the timing or ultimate resolution of such matter including possible eventual loss shareholder equity all registrant comed common stock warrantsthe following table present warrant outstanding stock based compensation plansyear ended december share award restricted stock performance share awardsperformance share award are granted under the ltip the performance share award are settled in common stock and in cash at the end of the three year performance period except for award granted to vice president and higher officer that are settled in cash if certain ownership requirement are satisfied the common stock portion of the performance share award is considered an equity award and is valued based on exelon stock price on the grant date the cash portion of the performance share award is considered liability award which is remeasured each reporting period based on exelon current stock price the value of the common stock and cash portion of the award are based on exelon stock price during the performance period coupled with change in the total shareholder return modifier and expected payout of the award the compensation cost are subject to volatility until payout is established for nonretirement eligible employee stock based compensation cost are recognized over the vesting period of three year using the straight line method for performance share award granted to retirement eligible employee the value of the performance share is recognized ratably over the vesting period which is the year of grant exelon process forfeiture they occur for employee who do not reimburse exelon under the term of the separation agreement see note commitment and contingency and note separation for more detail exelon ha executed an agreement to provide up to million to support shared in the million of the contingent payment obligation for the payment of contingent retrospective premium adjustment for the nuclear liability insurance following the execution of the settlement agreement edf no longer share in the obligation crp crp is collection of wind and solar project entity and some of these project entity are vies that are consolidated by crp while generation or crp owns of the solar entity and of the majority of the wind entity it ha been determined that the wholly owned solar and wind entity are vies because the entity customer absorb price variability from the entity through fixed price power and or rec purchase agreement additionally for the wind entity that have minority interest it ha been determined that these entity are vies because the governance right of some investor are not proportional to their financial right generation is the primary beneficiary of these solar and wind entity that qualify vies because generation control operation and direct all activity of the facility there is limited recourse to generation related to certain solar and wind entity in exelon interest in crp were contributed to and are pledged for the cr non recourse debt project financing structure refer to note debt and credit agreement for additional information of december and exelon phi and ace consolidated vie consists of consolidated vies reason entity is vie reason ace is the primary beneficiary ace funding special purpose entity formed by ace for the purpose of securitizing authorized portion of ace recoverable stranded cost through the issuance and sale of transition bond proceeds from the sale of each series of transition bond by atf were transferred to ace in exchange for the transfer by ace to atf of the right to collect non bypassable transition bond charge from ace customer pursuant to bondable stranded cost rate order issued by the njbpu in an amount sufficient to fund the principal and interest payment on transition bond and related tax expense and fee in the fourth quarter of the transition bond were fully redeemed and ace remitted it final payment to atf upon redemption of the bond atf no longer meet the definition of variable interest entity ace equity investment is variable interest by design it absorbs any initial variability of atf the bondholder also have variable interest for the investment made to purchase the transition bond ace control the servicing activity unconsolidated viesexelon variable interest in unconsolidated vies generally include equity investment and energy purchase and sale contract for the equity investment the carrying amount of the investment is reflected in exelon consolidated balance sheet in investment for the energy purchase and sale contract commercial agreement represent the amount owed by or owed to exelon for the delivery associated with the current billing cycle under the commercial agreement of contentscombined note to consolidated financial statement contentsnote separationexelon completed the separation on february through the distribution of common stock share of constellation energy corporation the new publicly traded company to exelon shareholder under the separation plan exelon shareholder retained their current share of exelon stock and received one share of constellation energy corporation common stock for every three share of exelon common stock held on january the record date for the distribution in transaction that is tax free to exelon and it shareholder for federal income tax purpose in order to govern the ongoing relationship between exelon and constellation energy corporation after the separation and to facilitate an orderly transition exelon and constellation energy corporation have entered into several agreement including separation agreement tax matter agreement transition service agreement and an employee matter agreement and other ancillary agreement pursuant to the separation agreement exelon made cash payment of billion to generation on january exelon issued term loan of billion on january and january primarily to fund the cash payment to constellation energy corporation and for general corporate purpose see note debt and credit agreement for additional information item change in and disagreement with accountant on accounting and financial disclosureall registrantsnone item control and proceduresall registrant disclosure control and proceduresduring the fourth quarter of each of the registrant management including it principal executive officer and principal financial officer evaluated disclosure control and procedure related to the recording processing summarizing and reporting of information in that registrant periodic report that it file with the sec these disclosure control and procedure have been designed by each registrant to ensure that information relating to that registrant including it consolidated subsidiary is accumulated and made known to that registrant management including it principal executive officer and principal financial officer by other employee of that registrant and it subsidiary appropriate to allow timely decision regarding required disclosure and this information is recorded processed summarized evaluated and reported applicable within the time period specified in the sec rule and form due to the inherent limitation of control system not all misstatement may be detected these inherent limitation include the reality that judgment in decision making can be faulty and that breakdown can occur because of simple error or mistake additionally control could be circumvented by the individual act of some person or by collusion of two or more people accordingly of december the principal executive officer and principal financial officer of each of the registrant concluded that such registrant disclosure control and procedure were effective to accomplish their objective all registrant change in internal control over financial reportingeach registrant continually strives to improve it disclosure control and procedure to enhance the quality of it financial reporting and to maintain dynamic system that change condition warrant however there have been no change in internal control over financial reporting that occurred during the fourth quarter of that have materially affected or are reasonably likely to materially affect any of the registrant internal control over financial reporting see item management discussion and analysis of financial condition and result of operation executive overview for additional information on covid all registrant internal control over financial reportingmanagement is required to ass and report on the effectiveness of it internal control over financial reporting of december
